review_title: You won't know why until you have one
review_text: Why do people love their Apple Watches? It's just a watch, for pete's sake! But if you have one you know right away. There's a small miracle that happens in a busy life when you can answer your phone (er, watch?) with your hands full. Or just glancing down to see the text message you just got. Or even completing those freaking rings (don't know? of you will). There's very little bad I can say after having my Series 2 for the last couple of years. I'm happy to get the 3 to have the always-on feature of cellular. I can leave the house and it's not even a problem if I left my phone. Or go for a walk without having a heavy phone in my pocket. It's not even about style, there's just a huge practicality of having a small device attached to your wrist that makes so many problems go away. Here are the positives:• Excellent watch. Like, as a watch.• Receive calls. Make calls.• Receive text messages. Facebook, Twitter, IG, and more.• Interchangeable bands. Fit the look you want, change on a dime.• Siri• Alarms, notes and all the other little apps.• Fitness trackingReally, I don't have any cons. I know people think a smart phone in your back pocket is the top, but this just changes the game. I don't know a single person who ever got an Apple Watch and didn't like it. And the funny thing is you'll never know unless you get one - Because how it changes what you do is the thing that makes it amazing. It's all those small little ways that make for a stupidly brilliant product.Seriously, you, your wife, your boyfriend - It make a perfect gift.

I am a Fitbit person. But I decided to slurge a little bit...... The only think that kept me from switching was that I had to charge the watch so much more. I originally had the Fitbit charge 2...... then I purchased the series 3 (42mm) and I love this watch but it was just far too big. So I am returning the 42mm and just received the 38mm and am much happier with the size. I wanted to really share the size difference. I love this watch so far... will review in the future.

review_title: A huge and worthwhile upgrade to a series 1
review_text: I love this watch! I upgraded from a series 1. It runs so smooth and flawlessly compared to series 1. It feels like what the Apple Watch was meant to be. The ability for Siri to talk back is refreshing. The ability to see HTML emails is a huge plus as well. And finally the fact that it is waterproof seals the deal.

review_title: Great for those who wear watches and are okay with daily charging
review_text: I like the Apple Watch Series 3. After trying it out for a few days I realized a few things: I don't wear watches often enough to justify the cost; You'll likely need to charge it daily; It's great for those who already wear watches everyday and can remember to charge it at night; You'll still use your iPhone to handle most tasks. If you want something only for fitness and/or sleep tracking buy a FitBit.

First off... I don’t write reviews, but WOW! was I impressed with this product. This series 3 watch 42mm GPS came brand new. The box was still seal and the protective plastic on the watch was still on the watch. I bought this for my nephew for his Birthday and was worry that when he opened the box their was going to be things missing I took a risk and I’m glad I did. Thanks to this seller and would definitely buy again. HAPPY HOLIDAYS!
Thought the 42mm was going to be too big with my small wrist. It ended up looking great and got here earlier than expected

Upgraded from a Series 1 to this Series 3.I can't believe the difference in speed!That alone made the upgrade absolutely worth it!The move between apps and the messages app are smooth and succinct.The added features that my old watch did not have are intuitive and time-saving: the raise to talk Siri is perfect and works flawlessly.Not having to "call out" to Siri is great.The walkie-talkie feature is a tad clumsy, but works well for a quick check-in to/from my wife while I am at work.The kids have enjoyed it too when they miss me during the longer days.While I have not swam with the watch, I have worn it in the shower a handful of times.The water eject button is quite intelligent.I think it simply uses sounds waves to push the water out of the speaker port.You can hear a "wshhh" sound, hearing its effectiveness.I will say though, the pitch/volume of the eject noise is quite loud...people WILL look!Like many others, I was hesitating between the new Series 4 and this Series 3.I got it for $229 for Black Friday and simply could not pass up that deal at nearly HALF off a new 4.I don't regret it one bit and am glad I took the plunge!

I ordered this watch this morning and it arrived 6 hours later. It’s brand new still in the official Apple box sealed and came with an extra band(S/M) and the magnetic USB. I must say I am thrilled with the watch, the speed of delivery, and overall awesomeness of Prime!

After getting the initial Apple Watch, I am so excited for the upgrade with the Series 3. After weighing the differences between the Series 3 and Series 4, I decided that this was not only cost effective but completely comparable to the Series 4. The newest model only has marginal differences such as an ECG meter and a slightly brighter screen, but in the era of negligible upgrades there really is no reason not to consider this model over the newer ones. Unless the Series 4 drops in price or even newer, future models has features like a selfie camera, why pay the price? Great for parents and students who want the power of a new Apple Watch without the price burden. Not a lower standard!

review_title: Brand new watch for 50$ lower than retail
review_text: I was kinda skeptical at first that this would be a refurbished watch or opened one but when It got delivered it was brand new with all the wrapping around it. The only thing that might be a problem for some would be that it did not come with a charging “brick” for the wall. No problem for me though since ive accumulated a ton. Battery life has lasted 3 days on a full charge so far and Ive used it in workouts and tracks steps gps data and heartrate very well. Havent tried the waterproof feature but I dont plan on wearing it near water anyway since apple doesnt cover water damage in any warranty

review_title: It's not techy enough, just texts to my wrist mainly.
review_text: Ok, I'm not that tech savvy but I thought the watch would do more! I really thought I could use Siri like I use it on my phone, which was a big selling point for me. 8/10 times I use Siri it tells me to continue on my phone. I asked Siri to take me to 'such and such' and it gave me directions with a vibration to the wrist with turns (really close to turning, should give a bit more time to get in the lane lol) which I like. It's good for having your texts at your wrist and that's about it for me. I tried to answer a call on it while my phone was in the other room but the quality was so bad they hung up. It won't set an alarm, only a timer. No Google/internet searching whatsoever (hince no Siri). No scrolling through your social media like FB or Reddit but gives notifications which is annoying. It's kinda like heyyyy pick up your cell and look at this. The battery is good, I haven't charged it in almost 3 days. It tells me to stand up if I'm sitting for an hour. I can ping me cell when I misplace it. That's about all i have used it for. I really didn't need to be closer to my text messages so it's not worth it to me.

review_title: Watched caused huge gash in my 12 year old while swimming!
review_text: My daughter got this for Christmas as she is a competitive swimming and was using the watch to track her swimming.Yesterday, January 9, she called from practice to tell me that the watch had cut open her arm and it was bleeding so badly that the coaches told her she needed to go home.The coaches cleaned up the 6 inch wound inside her upper arm.On close inspection of the watch, although not visible, I noticed a little lip in the beveled part of the glass.When I ran my nail under it it lifted and the glass looked like a razor blade.Checked online and found same complaints on apple website. Parents be advised.Thankfully it was her inner upper arm and not her wrist!

review_title: Already going out for repair; Received 6/23 and going out on 6/27
review_text: I read the positive and negative reviews for this watch before deciding to make the purchase.Things seemed to be overwhelmingly positive that the Series 3 was the way to go for an Apple Watch.As an avid Apple customer and my first Apple Watch, this seemed like a good first way to try this product line.I just hoped, really hoped, that I wouldn't get a watch that was a "lemon."I finally decided to buy it when the price dropped to $200.00 - I couldn't wait for it to arrive on 6/23/19.Everything out of the box was fine - totally legitimate packaging, came with a charger, paperwork, etc; no problems pairing with my phone.And then the problems started to happen:-Watch would not "wake" with certain wrist movements that I strongly suspected it should have been responding to (these were normal movements) - this is the repair part, so scroll down if this is all you want to read.-Text messages weren't showing up on my screen, although they were coming through; I could only see them by opening the message app.Eventually that resolved itself somehow (nothing was wrong in the settings on the watch or the iPhone Watch app either).-The notification "red dot" would not appear on the watch.Eventually that resolved itself somehow (nothing was wrong in the setting on the watch or the iPhone Watch app either).-"Hey Siri" command, when turned on, only worked about 30% of the time-"Raise to Speak" feature, when turned on, never worked on my watch and when I raised my wrist to try to speak, the watch face would not wake (and it was supposed to do so)To be clear, even though the Series 3 can get wet and can even be worn for swimming, I had not gotten this watch wet yet or worn it in the shower, so I knew that these issues could not have been caused by moisture.After reading that many other reviewers said that Amazon simply advised them to contact Apple about issues (which didn't surprise me), I called Apple Support.They told me the "Hey Siri" and "Raise to Speak" feature issues with the Series 3 watch were reported issues and would most likely be patched with the next software update - that was fine; annoying, but fine.I turned those features off.They said the "waking" issue was a software issue too.Everything would resolve with an update.They basically said everything would be an update fix.But in fairness, we tried so many troubleshooting fixes - I was on the phone for at least an hour and a half.So, they really did try to help and find the issue.The "waking" issue was still bothering me since the device wasn't even a week old and this was my only Apple device that has ever behaved in an unreliable manner.I also own a six year old Macbook Air that still runs completely smoothly.I also have a seven year old iPad 2, a nine year old iPod, and my current cell phone is an iPhone 8 Plus.I don't mean all that in a snobbish way - I say this to illustrate this point:all of my Apple products have been consistent in quality and functionality - I have never doubted whether they would perform the way they should.So I knew that this Apple Watch wasn't right...So I went into my closest Apple store today (6/27/19) so that someone could physically look at my watch and run an official diagnostic.My software was fine, but due to the "waking" issue, they told me the watch wasn't right.The tech verified the issue in the store and said that a full unit (the watch itself) replacement needed to be done - remember, I haven't even had this watch a week.Luckily, since I didn't wait to have the watch looked at by Apple, it was still under their official limited warranty.The serial number of the watch was fine - so the product was authentic.Due to the limited warranty still being in effect, the repair didn't cost me anything.The total cost of that repair would have been $229.00.I also bought Apple Care directly from Apple because I read in reviews that people had terrible trouble with their Apple Care codes from Amazon and "attaching" it to their account/product...so why not just get it from Apple?So, this huge review is all to say this:I will never buy a major electric device from Amazon again, regardless of how great the price may be.I lucked out with the Apple limited warranty, but I may have been up the creek if it didn't work out or if Amazon had refused to refund my money or send a replacement (which I read that some customers suspected that they may have received used watches as replacements...).I am also lucky because I'm now basically getting an Apple Watch directly from Apple because the repaired units have (I was told by Apple) brand new parts, not refurbished parts.If you think something might be wrong with your watch right out of the box, I urge you to take it to an Apple store so that they can look at it.Although Apple Support is really helpful, no one would have been able to actually figure out my issue if I hadn't gone into a store.As for my faith in Amazon right now, it's definitely gone way down.I'm not sure if I just got a random "lemon" from the Apple factory like I feared or if I actually fell into the boat of people who they may have gotten a used watch that got "prettied back up" and repackaged when someone sent it back who may have found the same issues I did.I'll never know.But I wanted to pass along my experience.I would say buy at your own risk and hope you get a good one like the majority of people here.
Did not receive the adapter for the charging cable.

After wasting most of a day with apple tech support, I had to accept the fact that this apple watch was defective. Decided to pay a little more and order directly ftom apple. I had such a difficult time understanding the Amazon representative! Finally, i think, my return authorization was taken care of. Who knows, Indian language reps?

review_title: Paid $283 For An Apple Box Without The Watch
review_text: Didn’t Even Recieve An Apple Watch In The Box.Just The Apple Box With The Charger & The Small/Medium Band.

Fantastic bit of kit, highly recommend purchasing it. You can monitor calls, txt and emails just by looking at your watch, tell Siri to txt/call someone while driving and people don’t even realize you’re talking through your watch while keeping your hands on the steering wheel!!! Can’t tell you how pleased I am!!

review_title: Don't Buy from Amamzon; sending defective returns as "new"
review_text: Bought Tuesday, has not worked properly once, lots of trouble shooting. Knew when I received my "new" item that it was obviously a return. That is how the world works, I guess, but it was also defective, and that isn't how the world works. Stop doing shady stuff like this, it gives your companies a bad name. Wish I could return it,but I lost part of the band, so I am stuck with a nothing more than a kids toy.

Genial! El contenido tanto la calidad del reloj es excelente. En principio había comprado uno que nunca llegó pero Amazon me hizo la devolución y pude comprarlo nuevamente. Recomendado al 100%. Excelente compra

review_title: Will not take a charge, and is now dead.*Update below*
review_text: *Update within parenthesis....(Took watch over to Apple Store, and thankfully it isn't the watch, but the charger, so beware if you have this issue. Not really sure now all pieces of this set is in fact new?)My daughter opened this yesterday. Let her wear it for a while before placing it on the charger. Did not charge at all. By the time I figured this out,I tried turning it on and off/hard resets, and then finally the update it needed through the app. It was too low on battery to complete the update. If that was the issue, it’s a moot point now. It’s a mini paper weight. Dead and unable to charge. I am getting my own watch in a couple days...so hoping my charger will work and that the actual watch for my daughter isn’t a goner. Very disappointing considering it’s a brand new item.

review_title: This apple watch serie 3 is awesome
review_text: I can use many words to define this apple watch serie 3, but it definitely can not be just one word, I can begin by saying that it is sophisticated, beautiful, luxurious, of great quality and very versatile ... I think I could say many other words about how good it is but I believe that I would extend a lot. I love this watch because it is super cool, you can read your messages just with turning your arm and looking down, answering calls, using GPS and a lot of things more. another thing that I like very much is the size is not too big andit is not very small.and it is very versatile due you can interchangeable bands so I can combine it with the color of your clothes or cap. the only thing that I do not like, and that is why I do not give the 5 stars, it is because after so many years apple continue with a square watch design, I would like them to take out a round model, however this does not take away the excellent that this watch is.<U+2705><U+2705> If you found my review helpful, please let Amazon know by clicking the helpful button below !!!
The watch was in a constant state of pooping the Apple logo and did not break out of it even with a reset.

I bought the Apple Watch for fitness tracking. It is THE thing at my gym. I went from a Fitbit to this and wow! I think the tracking is way more accurate.I’ve been one of those that rolled my eyes at this watch because who really needs this right? I’ve been pleasantly surprised at how much I love this and how have I lived without it? Everything cane brand new in the box - watch, band, charger. I did not like the band so have purchased another. The battery life isn’t great. I find myself having to charge every day or every other day. With my Fitbit, it was maybe once a week. But we all know Apple + batteries does not equal great things. So...go ahead and treat yourself! Order yourself one!

review_title: Once you go Apple, you'll never go back
review_text: As the owner of a Series 2 Apple watch forjust over 3 years, I had intended to upgrade to the new Series 4 watch until I saw Amazon's sale of the Series 3 watches.It was too good to pass up.I can't see much of a change in functionality from the Series 2, so no learning curve is required.After three years, the battery on my series 2 was approaching the end of it's life which required a recharge during the day to make it past 5:00pm.I expect at least three years of battery life out of this Series 3 before needing to upgrade again.My Series 2 watch put every other watch I own on the shelf, and I have no intentions of ever wearing them again.This watch does everything, even the things I didn't know I needed before.The main feature I wished was better is battery life.You only get about 18 hours out of a new, fully charged Apple Watch, so it needs to go on the charger every night.My biggest recommendation is to also purchase a screen protector.(Can't stress this enough, so BUY ONE!)That is very cheap insurance to prevent a very expensive repair if you're outside of the Apple Care window.I think I had to pay $200 to replace the display on my Series 2 watch, so consider yourself warned.

I wasn't sure if I wanted an Apple watch because I was not sure of the usage I would get from it. However, since purchasing it, I have been extremely happy with it. It is nice to be able to not have my phone on me (if I am within Bluetooth range which is a small range, but doable if you leave your phone in your purse and have to walk around an office). I am able to check and respond to texts, Messenger messages, and emails, and there are multiple features which allow you to silence the phone or put it on Do Not Disturb (just like the iPhone). Most of all, however, I love that the watch tracks my activity. I am not a fitness buff and I did not really have an interest in tracking my heart rate and steps throughout the day, however, it is fun to look at the statistics and set goals. I also like the, "Breathe," feature which coaches you through a minute of breathing--it helps you cool down and forces you to take a short break from life.Long story short: I thought I would regret purchasing this and that it would be a waste of money, but I am extremely happy that I did. I utilize it more than I thought I would and I love all of the features on it.

review_title: Wish I would've stayed with Fitbit
review_text: This has got to be my biggest disappointment with Apple.I have two iPads, a MacBook Pro, been using iPhones for over 6 years.So it's not that I hate Apple, but this ... was a complete disappointment.Glass screen is uber fragile, battery life is horrible, and the fitness components SO LIMITED!It's good with notifications and being able to respond, but my cellphone is always with me.So I feel this was just a useless investment as it does not track my sleep natively nor is its fitness app anywhere close to Fitbit's.Glad I didn't pay the premium "new released product" price, but I'd much rather have had a Fitbit Versa - even with their limited notifications.
First Apple Watch for my spouse as a Wedding Gift. She is excited and speechless... Will go with additional strap to add a sporty look.
It seems to be running great.They described it as new.. but it has a year + of someone’s workout on it.

review_title: Great Watch, Came In Brand New Condition.
review_text: Pros:Great FitComfortableEasy To UseLooks Amazing2 Day Battery LifeEasy SetupText Messaging, Calling, Music, Fitness, and Weather Apps Are All Easy To UseLots Of Fun To UseVery Quick Load Up Time On AppsCame Is Perfect ConditionWater Proof ModeVery ConvenientCons:There Is Not A Lot Of Cons I Can Put About This Product Right Now.38mm Is Small For People With Big WristsScreen Scratches and Gets Dirty Pretty EasilyComments:In Total I Love This Watch I’m Always Wearing With It’s Great Looks And Convenience. The 38mm Is Perfect For People With Small Wrist, But a Little Small For People With Big Wrist.This Came In Brand New In Perfect Condition In The Same Box And Everything. This Watch Has 2 Day Battery Life Which In My Opinion Is Ok It Could Be Better. I Would Recommend This To Anyone Thinking About Buying This.

i never thought i would get an apple watch, but wanting to add some tracking/encouragement to working out, i went for it. i also swim, so that was a big seller for me. i am SO happy with this watch. simple to use and works great. charge always last me at least a full day, if not 2. i got a Velcro strap for it, but the one it comes with is fine and comfortable. the tracking is accurate, and the swimming tracking is insane. it tracks each specific strokes (free, back, ect) distance you go for the workout which i am so happy with. love the product and highly recommend. for being a generation behind, it is still incredible.

I got my Apple Watch delivered with same day shipping on March 1st. I paid $219. Thought I was getting a pretty sweet deal on an older generation non cellular Apple Watch. Comes boxed up looks perfect. Works great up until around mid May. Touchscreen starts acting wonky. I can’t do anything. Can’t select stuff on the screen, can’t use a passcode. It’s hit or miss 80% of the time. I reset and unpair several times trying in vain to get my little watch to work. I give up and chat with Amazon, who politely tell me I have to contact Apple. No problem I do that. I chat with Apple. They tell me they will send out packaging to send the faulty watch back so it can be either repaired or replaced. I send it back and get and shiny new replacement. Now I have some suspicions about the first one I received. When you have the settings set to the Apple Watch unlocking when your phone unlocks as long as you are wearing it that’s a handy feature. Never worked with the first one. I had a little bumper guard that came with a band. Itdidn’t fit on the first one. Slid on perfectly on the replacement. Was my first one some sort of counterfeit?I think these heavily reduced 3’s on Amazonare very much buyer beware. If I get a 4 or the next gen after that. I will be buying directly from Apple.I gave 2 stars because don’t waste your coin buying it from here.1 star because you have to download a sleep app5 because the Watch app is okay3 for the battery life, cause it ain’t no Fitbit Charge. Lol.

review_title: Amazing X-Mas Gift at an Amazing Price!
review_text: This is a awesome gift at 225$ and prime shipped on black friday, in sealed box, with full 1 year warranty by apple. i'm very glad with my order. this is the Series 3 and has several updates from my previous series 1, love the waterproof design for this! it keeps me up to date with my notifications and more, without needed to take my phone out of my pocket every time it rings!

My husband bought me this watch as an anniversary present. I tried to pair the device to my iPhone for days... I reached out to Apple support online and they can not figure out the problem. I have a meeting with an Apple technician in person and if they still cannot figure out why THIS BRAND NEW WATCH will not pair... I am returning and better receive a new product that ACTUALLY works. I have been wanting an Apple Watch for years... my husband and I are so disappointment that this gift has been such a headache!!!

review_title: Is everything at Apple fragile? Cost to repair greater than the cost of the watch !!!!
review_text: I can count on one wrist the number of watches that I have cracked the watch face on, just one. Apple knows how to build a phone and peripherals are their forte because my MBP laptop and my phone have bags of accessories. They suffer though from building a watch that is not really a watch. I do hear stories of these watches surviving submerssion for weeks at a time and being discovered in the surf still intact and working. I've had this particular watch for six weeks. I travel but I'm not bouncing the watch around and dropping it. I just happened to look down and the damn thing is cracked. Did I bump against something? I couldn't tell you. All I can say is all my "classic" watches have never cracked. Tag Heuer, Rolex, Timex, Fitbit, none of them have ever cracked under more strenuous conditions - Apple? What can I say, all roads point to a lack of Jobs oversight but I believe that might be too simplistic. The durability isn't there and the cost to repair is greater than the cost of the watch itself. So caveat emptor or maybe cave tempus, vigilator - just know what you're getting into when you buy this watch.

I bought this watch on Black Friday and got THE BEST DEAL! No other store or websitehad the watch priced lower! It was brand new and I was still able to add Apple Care+ after my purchase! Love this watch! I didn’t want to pay a monthly service fee for it because really, I’malways going to have my phone on me. I’m still able to use it to make phone calls, text, check email, get my social media updates and lots more! When I’m at home or at the office, I can still move between rooms (without my phone) without Losing service! So glad I didn’t waste money on buying a watch with a cellular plan!

The watch for me overall is good! It came in an actual Apple box with all original apple parts. So as many people have mentioned in their reviews, the charging cord IS included but the little box that you plug the cord into and then plug into the outlet, is NOT included. For me this wasn't an issue considering I have plenty of spares and the 2 lamps in my room both have usb ports for the charging cord. I had no problem with setup. Both band sizes (S/M and M/L) were included. Some have said they have an issue with battery life. I have not yet experienced that. I worse mine for 2 days straight (excluding when I showered) and the battery was still at 40% when i finally charged it. I tend to sleep through alarms on my phone in the morning so I make it a point to wear the watch to bed. I charge the watch while I shower or while I'm sitting at my desk doing homework for school so my watch rarely drops below 60% battery. I've had to update it twice in the short 3 weeks that I have had it, but that an apple issue not an amazon issue. I had no problems with updating as some others have. I haven't tested the water resistance yet as I just don't quite trust it. Everything has always said that electronics and water just don't mix so until I get a waterproof case on it I'll just stick to what I know. I've seen a lot of reviews that say they essentially only use it to get texts when their phone is in another room, but I will say that I actually using the replying and calling features on the watch. Naturally the call volume and quality isn't the best but considering it's a WATCH that's not an issue so it's not worth all the other complaints on it. Working in a childcare facility, I can't have my phone on me at work. But living in Oklahoma during storm season, I like to be able to get updates from my weather app letting me know what's going on in case of inclement weather. Overall I have no issues. Especially considering the steal on the price!

Ok. I had recently purchased a Fitbit Versa, and was very happy with it, except for the fact that I could see my texts or incoming calls, but I could not respond to or answer them. Then I had a few friends tell me how much they love their Apple Watches. Then I saw this price. $199! I probably wouldn’t have purchased it if I hadn’t had a stash of unused Amazon gift cards, but I am so happy I did. I love this watch! Really. It has so many features. I love that I can track my steps easily. The workout functions are super easy. Also, with 3 kids and my hands always full, it’s easy to respond to a call or text from my watch. Honestly, I didn’t realize how much i’d Use this feature. The flashlight is bright, I can ping my phone (because i’m always setting it down and forgetting where), I can even take pictures with it. I also prefer this shape and profile to the Versa. I most definitely recommend this watch!!

review_title: If I could give this product 6 Stars I would
review_text: I never write reviews on products... ever!! but this is the most satisfied I've even been with a product that I've purchased online. I order the 38mm white Apple watch and it was so perfect, even came sealed in a brand new apple watch box. It came with two different sets of wrist bands as well as a charger. Definitely worth the money. Would recommend to anyone skeptical.

review_title: Iwatch was locked and I can not use it.
review_text: Product was activation locked. It is not useable.

review_title: This is trash— do not buy from Amazon!
review_text: Update: I took the replacement to Apple. They said it looks like these are such old watches they’re sending out that the only way to update the firmware is to send them back to the Apple warehouse. So if you’re willing to do that, the watch will maybe work? I’m just returning this and buying a new/working one from Apple...I ordered a watch. It came, it wouldn’t pair (like a lot of reviews I’m seeing). I talked to 5 different Apple representatives over the course of 2 days; their conclusion was I got a dud and should ask for a replacement. The new one came. It still won’t pair. It goes through the normal steps and then pops up saying it cannot pair. Apple doesn’t know what’s going on. Maybe it’s still attached to someone else’s Apple ID like a lot of people are saying? It’s not worth the money you save to buy it from Amazon. Don’t believe the 5-star reviews, this watch is useless.

review_title: Slow and overpriced even at new low prices
review_text: I am very underwhelmed with my first Apple Watch.Coming from a Fitbit Alta HR, my first impressions are that the battery life is much worse, it doesn't track your sleep and doesn't have alarms (that I've been able to find) to wake you up. It also requires daily charging and the only charging cable is too cumbersome to carry around.While I will be keeping it because the find my iPhone button comes in handy and the reminders to practice deep breathing are nice, I wish I had held out for a newer version of the watch.

review_title: It arrived earlier than what was first promised.
review_text: It connected and started up right away. No issues. love the look and feel. I didn't realize they send an extra band that is a bigger size. That was nice because I need the larger size band so I changed to it.

review_title: Very Disappointing, Just buy from Apple!!
review_text: As tempting as it may be to save a little money, just buy the watch from apple. I ended up paying $200 for a watch band and no watch. While amazon has accepted a return, it has not been as smooth a process as it should be, and the last amazon representative I interacted with was incredibly rude! Save yourself the headache, read the negative reviews before purchasing, I am not the first person this happened to and a number of other people received defective items!! I ended up purchasing the same watch from apple, paid a little more, but at least I got the watch and it works!!!
So when I ordered this I order the white band and silver case but I got the black and gray one.... other then that this watch is amazing!! I love it!

review_title: Great watch but FRAGILE! (And too expensive to fix)
review_text: Great watch but sadly not very durable. All the features are up to par with Apple products but the screen is extremely susceptible to cracking even with the slightest bump. Had it for a month before a small bump against a wall created a crack across the face horizontally; the touch screen does not function at all now. Apple repair is $289, which is more than the cost of the watch! Highly recommend getting a protective case for this due to the poor screen durability.

In the few days that I’ve had this it’s been very easy to learn on how to use the watch. The battery life is around as advertised, being approximately 18 hours, however I have not let it fall under 30%.The settings for notifications can be made to be grand, or very subtle. Being a student, having only the vibration that isn’t audible is very nice, especially if in a quiet setting.Sleep tracking can be odd for the watch as it hasn’t recognized me sleeping, however it could be that I move excessively during sleep or my heart rate doesn’t drop as low.I did however buy AppleCare+, after buying it here, from Apple directly.Overall very satisfied, will update in the future if complications arise.

review_title: Watch too fragile for ordinary wear and tear.Apple charges $159 for repair of known fault.
review_text: I bought this series 3 Apple watch on prime day in July 2019 for around $180. It worked fine and I especially like the heart rate and activity function. In mid-September I woke-up in the middle of the night with the face dangling from the watch. The face had a crack along the edge of the watch. I do not recall any particular incident with the watch like dropping it, slamming into something etc. I took it the Apple store and they told me they have had a problem with the face cracking on this model and there was a free repair as long as they didn’t determine it was caused by and accident. There was no Indication on the process they used to determine whether it was caused by an accident.I asked what was the cost to repair if they determined it was caused by an accident. They told me it would cost $159 to repair. I knew that I would never pay $159 to repair a watch I paid $180 for and that couldn’t hold up to normal wear and tear. So that is what happened, they wouldn’t repair for free and wanted $159 to fix it. So I now have a piece of junk. I truly do not recall any incident where I banged this watch so be wary of this fragile piece of electronics. I would never buy another one. Too much money( even with the prime deal) to have something that can’t stand up to normal wear.

I have wanted the Apple watch since its first debut.It was the thing to have the be all end all for watches.So when I caught the cool special at $120 I snatched at the chance.I am not really sure what I expected the watch to do toward enhancing my life. Does it look cool? Yes.Does it keep me constantly in the know? Yes.Does it have every gidget (i.e. app that is on my phone)? Yes.Would I have perished had I never gotten the Apple watch? No.Like my Iphone I don't use every app and because my job requires me to be on the phone and computer all day - let's just say I could do with always have constant contact with the world.It's a nice gadget.I like the look and interchangability.But the battery does seem to wear quickly and of course there is the perfect band you need to findand the protective face cover so you don't damage your investment.All in all, I would probably buy the Apple Watch 3 again at the same price.Butwhat do I know, I am still using my trusty Iphone 7.Too much in touch is sometimes - too much.

review_title: Super awesome watch (first time smart watch owner)
review_text: I’m only on my second day of using this watch so I hope I’m not posting a great review too soon but I LOVE this watch! It’s my first ever smart watch of any kind. I decided to get 3 series because I didn’t want to spend $500 on the 5 just to find out I didn’t like it, but after this one, I’m sure I would!I have been pleasantly surprised by the ease of learning the functions. I got the 33 mm because I don’t usually wear watches and I didn’t want something huge. It’s the perfect size and I’m so glad I didn’t go bigger!The texting is easier than I thought it would be.Siri and voice commands are super easy to use.Battery life depends on use but seems to be pretty good.Touch is very responsive.Volume is perfect.Pairing with my phone was a flawless process.I have no complaints so far! Worth the money especially if you only want to pay a fraction of the cost of the latest model for a watch that is great!

It’s exactly as described!Brand new and box was sealed!Best price!It’s replacing my Fitbit Versa.There is no comparison even though Fitbit has been wonderful to me.Nothing beats Apples display, size, functionality, etc.
Battery Life is not the best. Last me around 12-16 hours per day. Besides that everything works great!

review_title: Battery charger sucks, apps impossible to figure out
review_text: Received in a timely manner, apple care data was sent through email, was no problem as it gave agreement number and hardware serial number. HOWEVER, this thing eats the battery. I dimmed it, removed a bunch of stuff that ran in the back ground, battery still does not hold charge even for 24 hours. And to make matters worse (or maybe this is the worse part), the charger is absolutely a piece of junk. Took 6 hours to charge from 40% to 100%. I discovered I had to lay the charger completely flat and the watch on top. Anything less than that, the watch slides to the side a minuscule amount without being noticed and does not charge. I cannot charge at night I want the sleep data. Cannot charge for 6 hours in the day, I am fairly active. If the charger was designed to hold the phone in place instead of just stick with a magnet, I am sure the charger would be fine. And if you go to the apps screen, WOW, forget it. I have numerous logos which I cannot access since I have fat fingers and picking a single logo is not going to happen. Besides, I do not know what every logo means. PLUS: phone rang while I was outside and I answered it on the watch. That is a real PLUS. Sound quality not the best (come on, this is a watch), only one person had trouble hearing me but I was outside and it was a little windy.
The watch is perfect. It came two days later ALTHOUGH I paid for next day shipping!! I’m also missing the adapter that was suppose to be included.

review_title: I'm happy with it but it's far from perfect
review_text: I bought this watch as a replacement for my 5 years old garmin Vivoactive. Overall, I am happy with the upgrade, but not everything is better. Here's my pro/cons list:Pros:* Tight integration with iPhone. I love getting alerts, email, messages,etc. in a way that I can interact with them. On the Garmin, I would get the notifications but I could not read them (the font was too small) and the interaction was much worse.* I love being able to answer a call from the watch, this is an amazing feature and works very well.* I like how it looks. I bought a metal band and it looks great.* I like having a heart rate monitor, my Garmin was an older model and did not have this functionalityCons:* I hate having to charge it every night. My Garmin lasted a full week and the Samsung lasts about 3-4 days* It's a lot heavier than the Garmin* I am extremely disappointed that Apple has chosen to keep the watch faces locked. On the Garmin, there were tons of cool watch faces to choose from, and the Samsung has some that are way cooler than anything the Apple watch hasOverall I like the Apple Watch and I'm happy with it. I was able to get it for about $200, which is a pretty darn good deal. I don't think I would even consider paying the amount Apple wants for the new one.

review_title: Un buen producto por un precio justificado
review_text: Bastante sencillo para usar y muy buena la aplicación.

What a disappointment this watch is. I spent over 5 hours trying to get this watch setup and paired with my phone and all I got was a “pairing failed” message even after trying every suggested fix. I spent over 2 hours on the phone with tech support and they couldn’t figure out the problem. Now I have to wait to go to the Apple store (which is nowhere near me) and have them try to solve the problem. I should have just gone and purchased a watch from the store in the first place instead of on here. Terrible quality control! Apple/Amazon can’t even sell a working Apple Watch. What a joke and waste of my time and money!

I’ve had this for several months now. I explored in depth what was available for it to see what would deliver the most value for me. Sadly, it isn’t much.I “upgraded” from a Samsung gearfit 2 which was falling apart. It had been a couple years and it was time for something new. I quickly found that just because something is more expensive doesn’t mean it’s better.I like the overall construction and solid feel. The battery life is good enough for me to only charge it every other day. The band is pretty unique and fits comfortably. Thats about it.I really don’t like the firmware. The watch is trying to do too much all while failing at being a fitbit. I paid extra for a larger screen and still struggle hitting the tiny app icons. They display in a honeycomb array and there are far too many of them. Most of which you can’t remove because apple says so. You can display them as a list but again there’s so many it’s tedious to navigate. When do find the one you want it takes way too long to load. On the gearfit it was builtin. You swipe left and input water intake, swipe again and input caffeine, etc.. It’s quick. Track whatever you’re tracking and move on. The rest is automatic. For the Apple Watch you need to download water/caffeine/step tracking apps that either cost extra or are free and clunky. Once finally setup you need to wake the watch, enter your passcode, navigate to the honeycomb, find the app, wait for it to load, and then input your data. Each step takes a few more milliseconds than it feels like it should for $330 device.During workouts it pauses randomly for no reason. Disabling auto-pause doesn’t correct it. If you wear it inverted you’ll have to tap it to wake it up each time and then enter your passcode to resume which is such a distraction/waste of time I disabled it as well. This then means Apple Pay won’t work. I’m ok with the insecurities of not having the passcode though. If someone steals it they’d be inheriting my bad investment and freeing me up to buy something different.

review_title: The best there is for iPhone users
review_text: I had the original Apple Watch and loved it, but recognized some of the shortcomings.It wasn't waterproof, the battery life was poor, it was slow to respond, and it didn't have GPS.After a year or so with the original, I sold it and went watch-less for a couple years.I was ready for a new fitness tracker, so I did hours of research.Eventually I landed on a Garmin smartwatch.While it had its strengths, the UI and display killed the experience for me.I decided to return it and go back to Apple, trying out the Watch 3.If you are all-in on Apple products, there is no comparison to the Apple Watch.Unless you are really hardcore into a niche fitness activity, the fitness tracking features of the Apple Watch will be more than enough for your needs.The GPS is accurate and provides a detailed map after the activity is complete.Since the original Apple Watch, Apple has added monthly challenges for fitness.I really like these and it helps me stay mindful of my activities.The integration with App Store apps is amazing.I use Insight Timer daily for meditation, Spotify during workouts, the excellent Carrot Weather complication, and Uber when traveling.All in all, a seamless and pleasant experience.Battery life is greatly improved from the original watch.I can put the watch on at 6am, workout with GPS for 30-45 minutes, and still have 60% battery life when I go to bed.If you are questioning getting an Apple Watch...don't!It's one of Apple's best products and can literally change your life.

review_title: It works great and it's only $199!
review_text: I was super excited to get the product in the mail. The price was the biggest selling point for me. I have always wanted an Apple watch but, the price was a big problem for me. So, when I saw it on Amazon for $199, I was sold. Most of the reviews were positive, and I never had a problem before with Amazon when ordering Apple products (even certified refurbished items too). The watch even came before the estimated delivery date!The Apple watch came in a tightly sealed box (as do most of Apple's products do). The box contained everything a standard new Apple Watch comes with: the S/M and M/L wrist bands, the charging dock, all the paperwork, and most importantly, the watch itself. Everything was brand new and in impeccable condition. The watch came nearly with a complete charge and started up with no issues. The setup was easy and the watch synced to my apps automatically. I was able to pair with my phone and adjust the settings to my preferences. The watch's response is seamless, and it's fluid when switching between the watch and iPhone.I think the watch is worth the money if you're using it to trach your health and for hands-free purposes. It's great if you're always on the go and busy with work that you don't get much of a chance to check your phone. Also, if you're phone is stuck in your bag or if it's on silent, the watch is a great way to get those important notifications instantly. And if you're a commuter like me, it's a life-saver.

review_title: HOW IS THIS A CERTIFIED, REFURBISHED PRODUCT?!?
review_text: I am very disappointed and frankly pissed. I purchased this watch for my daughter to be able to have and USE before she starts back to school. The watch arrived yesterday morning. After unboxing, of course we immediately tried to set it up by synching it to her iPhone. After attempting this multiple times on her phone with no success, i decided to try and sync the watch to my own iPhone. Still would not pair. So i called amazon support who then transferred me to apple support. After being transferred to multiple different people and being on the phone for two hours with representatives who were trying everything to help me sync this watch to either of our phones, they determined that there must be an internal hardware or software glitch with the watch and that, unfortunately, there’s nothing else that we could try to get it to work. GREAT!! So now we’re here, stuck with a watch that was supposed to be “certified/refurbished” that does NOT work and now my daughter will not have it in time before school.

review_title: Stick with the Apple Watch Series 3 for Now
review_text: I had a Series 1 Apple Watch for 4 1/2 years.It finally died.I think moisture did it in.I was researching the newer models, mainly the Series 3 vs. Series 5.I opted for the Series 3, mainly because it was $199.99 for the 42mm version ($169.99 for the 38mm version), versus $414.99 for the Series 5 44mm version ($384.99 for the 40mm version).The Series 3 has a better battery life.It is water resistant to 50m; same as the Series 5.That was especially important to me, and a big improvement over the Series 1.Sure, the Series 5 has extra bells and whistles like EKG monitoring capabilities.But unless you are a cardiac patient, you don't need that.The other bell/whistle with the Series 5 is a fall alert to a third party.Again, I don't need that right now.The Series 5 also has the 44mm screen size if desired, which is a plus.Probably the biggest advantage of the Series 5 over all previous models is the always on display.Honestly, for an extra $200 for a Series 5, it isn't worth it to me.I have gotten used to tasing my wrist to see the display, and that function actually preserves battery life.In addition, the Series 6 is likely coming out in the fall, so if you're gonna shell out the "big bucks", I would wait 2 or so months.I would also expect the Series 5 to be discounted once the Series 6 comes out as well.Whatever you Series you decide on, I STRONGLY recommend you get a reliable screen protector.I bought a great one on Amazon for $10.99.I am very happy with my new Apple Watch Series 3!

I am a watch wearer and this has replaced all of my watches. I haven't used the full functionality of the watch but I primarily use it to workout. It tracks my workout progress and calories better than the workout apps I used. I haven't showered in it so I'm not sure how well it holds up in water but I do swear a lot when I workout and I've never noticed a difference in the way it functions. It is hard to use when your fingers are wet but that would be the case with any touch screen device. I don't often use the speaker on the watch itself when I'm talking on the phone but when I do, the people on the other end hear me clearly and I hear them clearly. Paring my phone and airpods to the watch was a simple and easy step.
El articulo llego incompleto, los componentes de la caja no son los que se describen.

I should'vebought this a long time ago !! I love all the features it has and I've only used in one day.I couldn't be happier with this watch and all the features. I have a 7 inch wrist, amfemale and the 42 mm screen is perfect for me, definitely not too big or bulky. The alarm is great for me. I'm a nurse and set it so I can remember all sorts of things, such as when to start an IV, give a pain med, or when I'm home when to put clothes in the dryer. You can even snooze the alarm. Messages come right to it , as well.I have it set for 24 / military time, which is helpful, too.

review_title: One of those wearables in which you don't need until you own one
review_text: I had a gift certificate to apple and was gifted a watch series 4. I had gotten as far as pairing it before I thought how redundant.This time around on amazon prime day, got this for a reasonable deal ($170~) and paired it. Same thoughts, uh-oh. But then I told myself I need to be objective and fair and give it a week.I use this watch for 1) strava without my phone in my pocket what a great feeling 2) as a remote for volume and skipping ads when listening to podcasts 3) a reminder for standing and breathing and well being 4) to send brief one button text replies to simple texts from family and friends.The fact that's it is all silicone allows me to wear it out style or sport and not worry about it too much. Ion-X glass is similar to iphone screens so it's pretty good, not as solid as a sapphire on my automatics (that's the ultimate for wearables).Well, now I have to sell about $18,000 in watches because the iwatch just made all my automatics useless.

review_title: Heart rate tracker helped alert me! <U+2764><U+FE0F>
review_text: I love the fitness and heart rate tracker on my watch. Able to track exercise throughout the day and steps at work. I had a crazy health issue the other day and my heart rate was all over the place. My watch gave me an alert that my heart rate had a huge jump of 30 points. I actually ended up being quite sick and ended up being hospitalized the next day with tachycardia symptoms due to septic shock. My watch in fact picked this up when it started happening.

review_title: Updated, Heart good. Mapping apps not ready for backcountry use.
review_text: I bought this Apple Watch 3 to do two things: measure my heart rate during workouts and help with maps on my wrist while hiking and dual sport motorcycle riding. It does the heart rate measurements OK but took work to get the settings right so that it wouldn't switch out to other apps while I needed to see the heart rate. Heart rate measurements are noisy and intermittent.The mapping apps are at best only poor for backcountry use. I need to import gpx tracks and see those on the watch. Not working yet.Frequently, I can't reach down and fiddle with buttons and knobs. I need to set it up once with a map display that has what I need in it and leave it there for sometime. Like a half hour. I've tried several apps including Gaia, topo, topo plus, viewranger, etc. They all are simply not ready for prime time yet on the watch.The weather app works intuitively well, so have updated the review from 2 to 3 stars.Very tempting to return the watch back to Amazon where I received it from a week ago. But I hate returning stuff.I will hang in trying to get this watch to do what I need and update this review if successful.Update January 12, 2020. I've owned this watch about a month now and I'm starting to get to know it better. It still hasn't supported very useful mapping in that I haven't found an app yet that will allow gpx tracks to be displayed on the watch. This was really one of the two main reasons for buying the watch so four stars might be generous.However the heart rate measurements are actually very good. Graphs are shown and, while occasionally there are wildly incorrect heart rates shown, those are relatively few. The heart monitoring app supplied by Apple does a good job of keeping track of workout heart rates vs resting rates, etc. It is quite good and I know a lot more about mine then I used to know. I'm 61 years old and have a resting rate of 49 and a peak workout rate of 160. I've actually discussed the 160 with my Dr to understand if I was in any danger. No problem but don't go any higher was the answer. So this was made possible by this watch.Also, there are other apps like weather and messaging that are very nice. Hence the four stars.

Once the series 4 came out, and with the holiday deals, I’m happy to have received the new pricing and opportunity to get the series 3 watch.I’ve never really liked any type of digital watch, since analog hands were just more desirable to me. . This gadget is more useful than any watch ever. Finally, tech to be happy to wear, and swapping the face is a great feature.
I have super tiny wrists and this fit better than the ones I tried on in store! Very pleased with this purchase.

I am ready to get rid of this watch. I’m having many problems with this Apple Watch. Recommend purchasing from Apple store direction and not amazon. The warranty and return period passed and immediately after it started glitching. Amazon said they could do nothing about it and provided zero support. DO NOT PURCHASE FROM AMAZON. Took it to Apple store for support and it was fixed for a day, now I am having same error. Apple warranty and return period is much longer.

I was looking for a replacement for my old Fitbit (the profile was too big and was getting caught on my baby’s clothes) and was contemplating going with the Fitbit watch because there were a lot of features on the Apple Watch that I didn’t think I’d ever use - texting or calling from my wrist was one of those features. Well, I received it and easily set it up. Within the hour of swapping out my old Fitbit for the watch, my newborn daughter had a poopy diaper which I went to change. Before I could get the new diaper on, she continued to poop right on the changing table, followed by some water fountain-esque pee. After grabbing both legs AND arms to keep them contained, I found myself in a pickle as her dad was out in the front yard and couldn’t hear me even if I yelled. APPLE WATCH TO THE RESCUE! I was able to call him and ask for help while maintaining a firm Hogtie hold on our daughter (My phone wasn’t even in the same room at the time).Since then, I must say that the watch has come in very handy on several occasions. As a first time parent, I didn’t realize how often you may need a third hand or how inconvenient a phone is to hold and use with a squirmy tiny human.This should be on your baby registry if you don’t already have one.

I have had my Apple Watch Series 3 42mm for several weeks now and I am enjoying it thoroughly.The built-in Apple Apps are excellent.I really enjoy the daily health goals it sets and provides info on and it has been invaluable in gathering data for a recreational mountain bike race I am training for.The builtin gps without cellular or the phone with you works very well.I have compared it to results from a bicycle mounted odometer.The apple fitness app has tons of activities available for tracking.I have use cycling, hiking, walking, and running so far.The screen is exceptionally sharp and bright.I was very pleasantly surprised by the battery life.I have taken it to travel for two long weekends without the charger.At night I put it into battery saving mode and was able to get through the whole weekend on a single charge.I have had a couple of fitness trackers.For the price of $229 at purchase, this is by far the best value I have gotten so far.Most other fitness trackers with gps cost significantly more than this and other people have shown that this performs nearly as well as products that cost 2-3 times as much.

Was really excited to buy this item. Worked great for about two weeks, then started malfunctioning. The touch screen stopped working, was not able to click on any apps. The screen would turn off a second after turning on. Very frustrating. I took it to the Apple store, the employee said he had not seen a watch malfunction like that before. Luckily Amazon accepted my return, which I am appreciative of - however, I hope they do not resell this watch as "new" to another customer.

I have been wanting one for a while and purchased it right before it went on sale (boo hoo) but I am enjoying it every much. I bought it for the health and activity features but love the fact I can read and respond to a text message on it, get weather updates and control my music. I wanted the newer one with the blood pressure monitoring but that will have to wait for now. Great entry level Apple Watch. If you're on the fence about spending the money on a watch, go ahead and try this one out. I think you will be very pleased with it.

I got the smallest size in the series 3.Very happy.All the apps I want to use on my watch are available.Pandora, My Net Diary, Pokemon, Heart rate app.Love the walkie talkie feature.Thinking of getting the larger one for my husband for fathers day.I chose not to get the cellular service because I really don't mind having my phone with me, but I love not having to take my phone out when I am on a run.I only wish the charge lasted longer that a day.Previously had a fit bit, 4-5 day charge, but I could not see the face when it was sunny out.Definitely sticking with apple.

I took advantage of prime day and bought the Apple Watch for $200. I thought I would love it but it didn’t grow on me at all. Prior to having an Apple watch I had a Fitbit and liked the simplicity of it. The Apple Watch had a variety of apps on it but a lot of them I never used on my iPhone so never used them on the Apple Watch. The most disappointing thing about the Apple Watch is the battery life. Every day I had to charge it which was extremely inconvenient. I ended up selling the watch and switching back to Fitbit.

My watch arrived very quickly. My husband heard a thunk and then the doorbell rang. Sounded like the delivery guy threw the package to our door. Inside of the oversized box was just the watch. No padding or anything. I was so excited to use it. I opened it up and synched it to my phone everything worked well except it was very slow turning on. I went to charge it and it didn’t work. I tried multiple outlets, charging blocks, and angles. Nothing. It would keep connecting and disconnecting it seemed. I messaged Amazon to try to get a new charger. Amazon was awesome and connected me to Apple. Apple went through diagnostic tests and after 15 mins, told me I needed to take it in. I was annoyed because I JUST got this watch and already there were problems. I was just going to return it but I really did like the watch.Edit: I ended up taking it to Apple at Best Buy because I was in the area. Within 2 minutes, the guy said, Yeah, this is defective. I would return it ASAP.” For the heck of it, I looked at Best Buy’s price which was $80 more. I told the employee my troubles and he was able to match Amazon’s price. I bought it right on the spot and it works great!I’m a little bummed that the one from Amazon didn’t work right. I was hoping to earn points on my Amazon credit card for the purchase. Oh well. At least Amazon was great about returning it.

Super easy to sync up and customize.Came charged so I was able to set it up immediately and begin using it in minutes.It came with a Large wrist band attached, but it also comes with an extra band for small/medium wrists.Love the magnetic charger which makes it really easy to take off and charge on my bedside table when it needs it.So far, I've been going a day and a half or so without having to charge, I also like that it reminds you when the battery is low.The various skins/customizations of the face of the watch make it super user friendly and easy to make your own.I'm happy with the purchase, and glad I didn't opt for a newer generation when this one has everything I need and at a much lower price point of $200.

Apple watches come defective, got a 2nd one as a replacement and issue still is happening. I called Apple tech support and they weren’t able to figure out the issue and suggest to just get a replacement again. Very disappointed that after all the trouble shooting we still couldn’t make it work.

Do not buy this !! I cannot tell you how much time I wasted trying to get this to pair up with my iphoneX. What should have taken a few minutes to set up ended up being hrs of frustration, getting Apple support, then having to run the watch all the way to an Apple store only to be told it needed to be sent out to have the software updated! It wasn’t able to connect to any iPhone at all. Apple said that’s what happens when you buy from Amazon? Just an epic 3 days of total frustration and wasted time. I wish I had never bought the watch!!!! 0 stars on this. I’m really disappointed with Amazon

review_title: I don’t see the hype, too many issues
review_text: I’m not 100% satisfied with the Apple Watch. Only because I’m not a big watch person in the first place, but I have to use one at my job(medical professional). This gen 3 is annoying how the screen turns on every time I move my wrist, and coincidentally when I actually need to see the time and turn my wrist towards me the screen doesn’t turn on....come on. Texting on the watch is a nightmare, the pad to scribble your letters is a pain to use, it always reads my letters wrong. Another annoying problem is multiple relies to a text, if I want to send more than one reply to a text as it comes in on my watch, I have to exit to Main menu and go to my texts to find the text I need. Overall, I don’t see the hype.

It's a brand new Series 3 Apple Watch being sold for $50 less than on the Apple site and arrived same day on a holiday (vs. 2 business days from Apple)...so I'm pretty thrilled with those variances. As far as the product goes...it's an Apple Watch. It isn't a necessity but it does link intuitively with an iPhone and serves as a decent fitness tracker. I have had a Series 1 for 3.5 years and it still works great. This Series 3 was a purchase for my wife and there are some improvements, but the only reason I'd replace a perfectly functioning Series 1 with the Series 3 is if I did serious swimming or wanted to wear while surfing. In short, if you don't already have an Apple Watch and you are on the fence - buy this one.

My first iWatch was a series one and this purchase was made after not wearing a watch for almost 20 years.When the series 3 went on sale, I was like, "booyah!" and grabbed it. I chose to purchase the 38mm because that's what my series 1 was so I could keep using the same watch bands, which numbered around 18 or so (all purchased from Amazon).I can honestly say that I use with "watch" less as a watch (I occasionally check to see what the time is), but more as a timer for work and home, tracking my steps and importantly, tracking my heart rate. My doctor had taken me off a medicine and I found that my heart rate had gone up. I remembered that the watch tracked my heart rate ad I was able to show the doc how much my heart rate had increased and when. Just that made the iWatch totally worth the money.If you've been on the fence about getting an iWatch, think of it more as an extension of your iPhone than just a watch. It's pricey, but totally worth every penny I paid for it.

review_title: Was iffy to try this, its pretty decent but ....
review_text: Okay, I am an apple freak but I NEVERwear a watch. I've been debating about trying one seeing that a majority of my clients have them on and love them. I saw it on sale and figured I would try it. I have to say I do really like it but the battery doesn't last more than 24 hours (which isn't horrible, try to charge it while you are sitting for a while), the sleepwatch app works the best of all that I tried and is easy to use, it is really nice not to have my phone out all the time and still see what's going on. I LOVE the driving maps on it, especially living in hands free MN, I love talking on my phone if I need my hands and it is pretty comfortable to wear. I also like the heart rate monitor. What I don't love, I sit for my job and yet I reach my standing goals every day...um, sitting. That is a little frustrating but hey, its not like the watch can sense how far I am off the ground. Not sure how accurate it is overall, but it gives me something to go off.

Compared to the Fitbit versa 2 this is a bust!Pros:1. Changeable bands(very cute options)2. Changeable watch facesCons:1. Battery life( last half a day and I don’t use it for a phone or music just a watch)2. Very bulky and I bump into everything when I’m wearing it(my clumsy fault)3. Takes forever to charge (runs out of battery in no time)4.disconnects from the app by itself!5.takes forever to turn it back on after it’s been sitting on the logo screen for 10-15 minute usually!I wouldn’t buy it unless you buy the newer one might be faster and work better!

review_title: Just break down and get it, you won’t regret it.
review_text: I am so glad I purchased this!!!! I’ll admit I was a little skeptical just as others were saying because of the description stating it was an Amazon renewed product. I honestly expected it to come in a brown box, plastic wrap all over the watch from being refurbished, etc. - and I also honestly thought people posting pictures of the item coming in new packaging just got lucky lol BUT mine came in all brand new packaging, sealed up and never opened before. If it is a refurbished product they did a bang up job of mocking the real satisfactory feeling of opening Apple packaging lol. Aside from it arriving in perfect condition, it also arrived a day early. I’m so in love, people are right. You don’t even know until you have one. Then on top of the early delivery, flawless new packaging and perfect condition, the watch itself works like a champ. I honestly had a hard time deciphering between the different features of series 1, 2, and 3 but what I do know is this thing has everything you need. It’s water resistant up to a certain level but regular swim sport and play is A Ok with it - just no scuba diving and high impact stuff like water skiing. Read and reply to text messages. Receive, make, and answer calls. If you use apple wallet get ready for a game changer lol plus a lot of the apps you use will have Apple Watch apps to go with it, so you have a ton of things to play around with. It’s true, battery life only lasts one to two days if you’re using it regularly like me, but that doesn’t bother me. I don’t wear it to track my sleep so it charges every night for me. All in all, this thing rocks and I’m so happy I finally broke down and made the purchase.

review_title: I'm impressed but the battery life and the price are little to be desired
review_text: This is an awesome product, no doubt. Being able to access Siri, the weather, send/receive messages, make calls, and access many of my apps with the flick of a wrist is amazing. I tried a knock off because I didn't want to pay the price for the few things I wanted the watch for. This watch is a lifesaver at work. I love not missing notifications for meeting reminders and communications with my team.I am only giving this three stars because the battery life is pretty poor. I know the watch is performing so many functions and requires a lot of juice. I have adjusted the settings on the app so I can squeeze out three days before I have to charge. I do wish there was a quicker way to put the watch in sleep mode when you just want it to be a watch. It does this but it takes a bit to get into the settings to do it. This would be one step closer to saving battery life. Also, one of the ratings said sleep tracker- I haven't found this yet on my watch so I rated this as a 1-star. I didn't get it for this purpose but will now spend some time looking for it.I didn't get this watch as a health tracker but am interested as I get older to see what I can learn about myself so I'll see if this watch helps with that. It does help me with my busy work and grad school schedule right now, which I am very grateful for.Now, if I they can just add a solar charger so it charges itself throughout the day! Come on Apple, I am counting on you.

review_title: Never thought I’d own one but I love it
review_text: My job doesn’t allow cell phones at work, that being said I can read and respond to texts very quickly and no one knows. It also sends me alerts about my fitness,I found it annoying and furnished but it surprisingly motivates me to put in that extra 10 minutes to meet my fitness goal

review_title: Works perfectly but buy another wrist band
review_text: I love this Apple Watch. I personally have not tried the sleeping tracking but one of my coworkers had got an Apple Watch after I told her about them and she said that it works perfectly. You can count your steps, message, call, play games, use the GPS and probably many other things that I just haven’t found out about. But the thing I most like about the watch is that you can put a passcode on it and when you take it off it locks. Because while I was grocery shopping the bangLoosen while I was carrying my cousin to the car and dropped and I didn’t noticed til I looked at my wrist by this time the watch was gone and I started tracking it and found that someone turned it in to the cashier thank God I put a passcode on it or it probably would not have been returned. But I would recommend buying another wrist band because the worst band it comes with will loosen easily and slip off without you noticing til the last minute.

review_title: I love it and I can’t say that enough!!
review_text: Don’t know why I didn’t get this earlier. I had been buying all these other brands of smart watches and they ended up breaking and then I’ll buy another one and then another one. Wasted money away and then finally decided to spend a little more to buy Apple Watch. I have been missing out a whole lot. This is the watch I should have bought years ago. It has everything I need and more. It’s the smart of the smartest of the sports watches. Tracking my activity and everything else is here. If you haven’t bought one yet, you’re really missing out.The only thingI don’t really like is the battery life is poor. I have to charge it every day. Hey but I don’t mind doing that.

review_title: a very nice weatch 38 mm white band
review_text: I just bought this old version apple watch 3, instead of more expensive apple watch 5 because my main purpose is to monitor my heart rates, while waiting for a future model that can measure both heart rates and blood pressure. it costs $169 and I used installation payment of 6 months. What can you expect? it seems almost costing nothing! But I have found it is a super nice watch, like other apple products, high quality, beautiful and also having many functions! (I might like many people, did not think such a watch had much use), I was totally wrong! I can use it in many ways including listening to audio books! A very nice feature is that I set up Earth as the watch surface, so I can see our beautiful planet all the time and see it rotates with sunlight covering my location. From the watch surface Ican also check the weather of my city instantly (after set as the default location). I am very amazed by this product.

The real. I love this watch. The battery is t the greatest. You’re not going to be able to sleep track unless you charge it before sleeping. I typically charge my watch every evening to have enough charge for the next day. I opted to not get a cellular version because who really doesn’t have their phone near them most of the time? I have always said I’d never buy it but it was worth every penny! It also comes with two bands so I wouldn’t worry about sizing. You can also compete with your friends in fitness games.

I've had this product for ten months and used it regularly for fitness monitoring and various other applications.The battery charges fairly quickly, but with frequent or continuous pairing with my iPhone, lasts less than two days.That means I have to put it on the charger every night or run out of charge the following day.This takes away from it's usefulness as a sleep monitor.You can't do both.It's either on the charger or on your arm.Even more disappointing than the battery issue is the ease with which the watch face can be scratched.I don't do anything out of the ordinary in terms of exposing the watch face to abrasives, yet it looks like I've had the watch for ten years!Scratches everywhere.Bottom line.Over-priced and poorly fabricated.It will be my first, and last, iWatch.

review_title: Would not pair! Seems like a common issue.
review_text: This would not pair to any of our iPhones. I spent hours trying to get it to work. Amazon technical service transferred me to Apple support. They couldn’t get it to work either. They scheduled me an appointment at the Apple store which is a half hour from my house. They couldn’t get it to pair either. It is now being sent off to Apple and I have to wait. After having these issues, I read a lot of reviews with the same problem. The software is the watch hasn’t been updated and it can’t be updated without pairing it an iPhone. UPDATE: I received my watch back from Apple repair and it works great! They updated the software. I love the watch, but would recommend buying it from somewhere else until this issue is resolved with the batch on amazon.
Fue en regalo de cumpleaños de mi novia y le encanto, tuve varios problemas con este articulo y mi banco pero ya esas son cosas que se salen de las manos del vendedor.

Although I have not used the sleep tracker or mobile app yet, this watch has been amazing so far, I absolutely love it. Apple products seem to never disappoint. I wish the battery life was a tad longer but no biggie considering it charges super fast!! My box came with the watch, a charger, and 2 different size wrist pieces for the watch just incase your wrist is bigger or smaller. I was definitely surprised with how amazing this product is overall.. I used to have a cheaper “Fitbit” type watch but it wasn’t accurate with the information. I confirmed how accurate the heart rate monitoring was by checking it myself while comparing to what the Apple Watch says. If you are thinking about purchasing this then just BUY IT NOW. For only $199 it’s a steal. I definitely won’t go back to using my old watch. I would recommend getting a Clear, rubber type “casing” screen protector for it just so it doesn’t get scratched or ruined from everyday wear.

I can verify that this is a brand new-straight out of the box Apple Watch! I have been consistently wearing it for roughly two weeks now and I love it! I have had no issues with it, it came in pristine conditions, the battery life is as decent as I expected it to be, and it performs all of the functions that I need it for. I will warn, I need to charge mine about once every 2-3 days, which is a bit more than my previous smart watch, but since I use the Apple Watch more throughout the day I’m not too upset about this. I would definitely recommend, especially when the watch goes on sale. It’s a great buy and it is a genuine product!

I just received my watch and I'm happy with it.I see the website says it includes a power adapter however it seems that Apple perhaps stopped including them?The box is too flat for one to fit.That being said, I called Amazon and an agent agreed to send me one at no charge.Amazon sells them for $15 so if you don't receive it, give them a call.I suggested that they change the listing if in fact none of them include adapters.The price is great (even without the adapter).This is an upgrade from a Series 1 and it seems faster and the screen is brighter.

Came exactly as ordered. This one is an upgrade from my gen 1 series watch, but I didn’t feel like shelling out close to ~$800+ for the new gen 4.The battery life isn’t as bad as I’ve read in previous reviews. At the end of the day, I’ve had from 50-60 percent battery life, and that’s with moderate to heavy usage. You still have to charge it every night, but I personally don’t consider that much of an issue.I’ve already persuaded my sister into buying one and will definitely continue recommending to friends and family.

review_title: Why did I wait so long!
review_text: For the past several months, since working at home, been using my commute time to workout instead. My stationary bike has a heart monitor but was sometimes off, so I decided to get a wearable (I had a very simple activity tracker). Thought about (and read about ) an activity tracker (Fitbit, others) but decided to look at the watches instead. Did a lot of reading of reviews, and for my purposes/needs, decided on the Apple 3. Since arriving, I have been wearing daily and love it!. Battery time is about a day (which is what I expected). It connected easily with my iPhone. I'm using it for tracking activity; there's an exercise icon that you can set for a specific activity (indoor or outdoor walk, cycling, running, yoga, elliptical etc).
