The activity icon is a great motivator (love seeing the circles close)! I bought a screen protector and extra bands-to change it up (easy to change, push the button and band slides in/out). Love my watch!

review_title: Hot diggity dog what a watch!
review_text: What a watch! I hope you have TIME to read this review bc you’re gonna WATCH the story of me and my watch unfold.I always liked the idea of an Apple Watch, but I used to not like it wear watches at all. I thought it was a waste of space on my arm and honestly a lot of people look kinda nerdy with them on. Plus, why would I wear a watch when I have my phone w me always? Or I can just ask tbh. But idk man, something in me changed and I started casually looking at watches at stores more and really taking notice watches on people. I then saw SharkWatches and I was like omg nuuuuut I gotta have one. It’s sporty and I fw it ya know. So I got one on the 50th Anniversary of Shark Week and it’s got sharks all over it it’s pretty dope ngl. Soon I became dependent on it and felt naked without it on. I was a watch person now and there was no looking back. So I realized I could get an Apple Watch bc I’ll actually use it now. I asked my momma for Christmas for one and spoiler alert, I received this bad boy. SooooooooooIf you’re looking for a watch to brag to all your friends about, look no further! These bad boys are one step below air pods on the bragging scale. Do shut on your watch in front of your friends to assert your superiority. Go crazy with it! Just go insane !Anyway I really like the watch it’s a great product. I wear it everyday and learned everything about it so I could use all it’s dope azz features. I recommend

review_title: Review of Apple Watch Series 3 (GPS, 38mm) - Space Gray Aluminium Case with Black Sport Band
review_text: We have become an Apple product house (2 iPhones, 4 iPods, 2 iPads) and have loved these products.With my wife running, it made logical sense to purchase the Apple Watch Series 3 as it would offer seamless integration with her iPhone.The box is typical Apple. Simple, functional and everything is put in place perfectly. The phone came with some charge so it was ready to be used (did require a proper charger thereafter). Setting it up on Apple Watch app was easy, and she was ready to use it within minutes.It is light on her arm, doesn't cause excessive sweat when not being used during exercise, and is unobtrusive when being worn.I see the price has dropped a bit too, and it's worth picking up on the Series 4 if you can.

What a nightmare. Purchased for new fitness challenge and it came already attached to an Apple ID. Got the run around from amazon for 40 minutes and treated like garbage. Finally told them to pay the difference for the new one or unsubscribe me from prime and I’d go to Best Buy. They agreed to pay the difference for the new watch. Idk who failed at amazon, checking on Apple IDs but they need fired. Started my challenge with no tracker, days behind others now.

People say you don’t know why everyone loves their Apple Watch til you have one and boy are they right! I tried several other smart watches that had lots of problems before trying Apple. Wish I had just gotten one of these in the first place. Watch came new, sealed in the box. Works perfectly with no problems at all. I use my watch constantly all day at work and only charge it every other night! Other watches I tried barely made it to the end of 1 day. Love this watch!

Why did I wait so long to purchase an Apple Watch???? This beats fit bit hands down, so many cool features. Most importantly, you can actually see the clock face when you are outside!!! That used to bug the crap out of me. what good is a watch that I couldn't read half the time.I love that I can wear it in the pool, answer my phone in the pool, and control music while in the pool.Its a cool looking watch too, and the band is real comfortable material. It doesn't come undone either.I am so glad I finally bought an Apple Watch. I am done with Fitbit.

review_title: Great product, glad I went a few models back.
review_text: A really cool 'device' because it does so much more than just a watch. I typically am a regular watch kind of guy but bought this for the activity feature. At first i wore it everyday over my regular watches and loved the features. Charges easily and looks very sleek. Connects seamlessly to the phone and others when permitted.I still have the standard strap on it as i like the simplicity of it but in true Apple fashion the abundance of accessoriesavailable make it very easy to customize. I went with the 38mm because i didnt want to risk something too large on my wrist and because of the small difference in price. Still undecided on whether the small additional cost would have been worth it but overall happy with the purchase.I'm glad i bought the 'older' model because i just dont think i could have justified the price for the more current ones.

review_title: Ok. Battery life not great. Kind of just for fitness motivation
review_text: This watch is undoubtedly a great tool for different purposes based on personal schedule / lifestyle. Love the features but really my main concern is always tracking my steps and activity and having that motivate me and battery life. This does a great job as long as you keep it charged. I have noticed the battery life out of box is very unimpressive. I have heard that from many. I also wish Apple had the same charging port as the phone etc. as an option but understand that would cause issues with waterproofing tech. It’s ok. Unless you’re a huge Apple person or need the features of texts/ Apple exclusive features I may opt for a better bargain watch of another brand. It is lightweight and I will keep but I would never pay more than I did for one of these. They simply are a bit overpriced for what they are. SURPRISE. Welcome to the world of Apple. Will keep

I’ve always been a Fitbit user and I’ve owned many models over the years, including the Ionic and the Versa. I really haven’t been impressed as of late, so when I saw this on sale for $199, I jumped at the chance. Now that I’ve been wearing it for a few weeks, I will never go back to Fitibit! I’m obsessed! I love all of the customizations and integrations with my new iPhone. I was a bit hesitant to purchase the 3 and not the 4, but I’m so glad I did. I’m pleased with the speed and the battery life (lasts about a couple days for me.) Also, as a fitness professional, I love that, although it does track your steps, this watch focuses more on calories burned and movement. I’m sure I haven’t even scratched the surface of what this incredible watch can do. So glad I made the switch!

Well after an hour of trying to get it to connect to my phone and failed time after time I called apple support and 3 hours later I find out the watch won’t update due to the watch having such an old version on software.Update they have pushed a software patch though love the product I just wish it would have worked right away when I took it out of the box

This watch is amazing! I bought one because my parents always seem to call me when i’m driving and I needed a hands free way to answer and still be able to keep my eyes on the road. The watch came with two band sizes and a charging chord. I absolutely love it and am so glad I bought it. I got the smaller size and I was concerned it would be too small due to me being a plus size person, but it’s perfect! I love this watch and i’m so happy I finally bit the bullet and got one. It’s one of those things I wasn’t sure would really make a difference, but it’s helped me in so many areas. It shows me reminders, messages, calls, any notifications I get, I can pay with it, Keep track of activity and exercise, etc. It’s amazing! It came with everything I needed and the battery life is super long! At the end of a full day of use mine is still at 30%. So happy with this purchase!

review_title: Don’t expect to buy a new watch!
review_text: I’m the type of person to do my homework on making expensive purchases. I looked at all the sites that sold Apple watches Every major store had roughly the same price for a series 3. So I decided to purchase through this seller due to the price being slightly cheaper. I was under the impression that this watch would be new due to the fact there was no text stating it was refurbished. When the watch arrived I noticed that the Apple box was not wrapped in plastic and the box was scratched up which was a red flag there. Then the watch band had some sort of orange markings on a white band. The face of watch had noticeable scratches and a small chip as well. I thought I would try to pair the watch with my phone and was unable to because the watch was still linked to someone else’s email. So the watch was completely useless to me. I understand that this is an older model, but if you are going to sell a refurbished watch you need to state it in the description. Also you NEED to make sure the watch isn’t paired with another persons email before selling to a customer. The watch could have been stolen for all I know. Watch was retuned and I ended up buying a watch from the Apple Store.

review_title: Going back to Garmin! Apple Watch generated hairline crack in first 30 days. NOT COVERED BY WARRANTY
review_text: Going back to Garmin Smartwatch products! Long time Apple customer with many MacBooks, Mac Minis, iMacs, iPads, iPhones, etc at my business and home over the years. First (and LAST) Apple Watch based on my first 30 day experience.The Apple Watch 3 screen generated a hairline crack on day 30 of ownership. Bottom of screen is now non-responsive to touch, so watch can no longer be unlocked. Watch was not dropped at any point. Apple support had me send in to the Apple repair center after a week of back and forth between local Apple warranty provider, Amazon support, and Apple support. I believe crack is due to manufacturer defect, but Apple repair center does not agree. Apple repair center quoted a $229 repair, which is same price as new watch! The same Apple Watch 3 normally costs $229 new.Even if I had purchased AppleCare+ ($49), Apple insists I would have had to pay the Accidental Damage repair fee ($69). Since I have contacted Apple about problems with this Watch, the watch is NO LONGER eligible for AppleCare+ coverage. Total out of pocket $118 ($49+$69) is certainly less than $229, but I believe this type of defect should NOT incur the $69 repair fee either.I've been a long-time fan of the Garmin HR watches for running and cycling. I've experienced several trouble-free warranty claims with Garmin over the years and I would have expected SAME or BETTER warranty support from Apple. I hope Apple considers changing their warranty repair policies for anyone else who may experience a similar situation.

review_title: Great series for the simple things
review_text: If you are more into the applications of the watch instead of just something to receive messages/calls on then this review won't be much help but if you are looking for the simple things then please do read on!I personally just wanted an apple watch to get notifications of messages/calls so I wouldn't have to carry my Max size phone everywhere with me and especially at work if its important I can see the message. This watch so far as not disappointed! I do not like small screens (reason for me having a max size phone instead of regular) so I do not really care for all the extra features on the watch besides notifications and of course telling time (:Battery has been great, has lasted a lot longer than my phone that's for sure. I do charge it every night but by the time I get done with the day the battery is at like 60% before I even put it on the charger. The S/M band was great size for me!There are some misleading reviews about what comes with the watch. In my box I received the watch automatically attached to the S/M band but it also came with a M/L band in case it was needed. I also got the charger for the watch.I received the 38mm face size which is a great size for me because I do not like big and bulky but I am sure i would have been happy with the bigger size just didn't want to spend the extra money. I also ordered a pair of the silicone screen protectors to put on (2 protectors for $8).You set up your watch through the app on your phone which is very convenient cause I can't imagine setting it up on that little screen. Great watch and I am so happy I finally got one even if its the series 3 a lot of people say that it is just as good as the new models and cheaper (:

Interesting watch. Not as much detail as the fitbit but it does have a customizable screen so you can see what you want on the screen instead of having to only use the phone.Like the fact that I can answer calls with the watch, which is good when I happen to step away from the phone while it's charging and can still see the call. Just wish the battery life could be longer, but given what it does and how much it can be customized withe the different complications, I can see why it's a short charge hold.

Man I remember when these were $529 , this is an amazing deal it works amazingly and watched many yt videos that recommended this one instead of the upgrade, very easy set up. Make sure to update your phone to speed up process (:Mine is the 38 mm in Space gray aluminum, although I ordered a pink sand band for $5 separately! Also and extra band comes inside in case the size you git ended up not fitting as well as a charger without cube !

review_title: Great birthday gift for my wife.
review_text: Bought this for my wife's birthday, she loved it. Works great out of the box. easy pairing with IOS. (Look up how to get the exact notifications you want to show on the watch) after a bit of tinkering it's great, many features you aren't looking but turn up being helpful.Some of the features my wife really likes:- Siri on your wrist.- Only the notifications you want, good for meetings.- Hands free calls, good for quick calls.- Speech recognition for replying messages quickly without getting the phone out.- Gps for running workouts.- Spotify quick controls.- Looks great.

Volume on watch was to low to use on phone. Talking person on other end said was scratchy and couldn’t understand me.Used phone for everything. I seen on youtube two way conversations were clear and loud. This on i have tried everything to hear it was not to happen. Will try one more time today. I got it for phone and gps while driving and textIng when not near phone. . Just as easy to use phoneIf volume wont be loud enough to hear. Will go back. Could just be this watch. Many for sale refurbished or renewed As they say.Wanted one for so long. Not just now. Can’t 5 star it cause it’s not working for mine. I seen it work fine on 1 and 2. For speaker volume. seen it work on youtubealso make sure you want it. went thru hell on return, cant do return thro your orders, it makes you call cust service to reset watch. and they will generate ther eturn, its easier to drop it off a ups store, can return it that way. save all return info,, you'll need it..

Pros:-You can tell the time (its a watch.)-You can (sorta) text-Games?? technically-tracks your steps and heartrateCons:-Other than telling the time and tracking your steps, heart rate, and sleep, there is not much this thing can do-You have to either scribble out your texts or use speech dictation. scribbling is good for one word replies but thats mostly it-Apps on this thing barely have any functionality. For instance, on the robinhood app, you can only view your portfolio’s value and the price of your stocks. You cannot see or do anything other than that. no trading. no viewing trends. nothing.-The games on this app suck. they use either the touchscreen for simple up down left or right movements, and the watch dial.-Probably the most undeniable downsideis that you have to charge it every night. so whats the point of the sleep tracking feature?!dont waste your money. buy a regular watch and something nice for yourself with the money you couldve spent on this

review_title: The most confusing apple product ive ever bought
review_text: I bought this watch so i could track my miles, listen to audible books snd podcasts and so far i havent figured out how to do any of that. This is the most un-user friendly apple product ive ever purchased. It comes with zero instructions so im googling you tube, tech support calls to audible and apple and im still extremely frustrated. All i want is to easily transfer info from my phone watch spp to the watch. Errors, trying this and that mostly unsuccessfully. If i cant download audible books im sending it back. Steve Jobs is missed!!

I’d put off buying an Apple Watch because of the price but after having gone through several other trackers, I decided to gift myself with the one I really wanted and I’m so glad I did!! Changing watch faces is simple (I’m currently in love with the Minnie Mouse face because when I tap it she announces the time and if it’s the 1st time that morning she follows the time with “good morning!” which makes me smile). The activity tracking is good and I enjoy the reminders to stand up and to breathe. Great purchase no regrets.

review_title: Excellent battery life, comfortable to wear, fantastic and accurate tracking of exercise
review_text: LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!I use to have a Fitbit Charge 2 HR. Even though it said it would automatically track exercise, it didn't. It took forever to connect to my phone. It didn't do a great job of tracking the exercise even when I did manually start it. I would be at the soccer field running and it would say that I had gone up 20 flights of stairs. Plus, the battery life just wouldn't last. Just not accurate at all. That is not the case with this Apple Watch. It is really accurate. Automatically tracks exercise. Its lightweight and comfortable to wear. I usually forget that I have it on.Easy to learn how to use and definitely worth the money (although its not that expensive).I wear it everyday all day and the battery is still at 65% at the end of the day. Its a beautiful watch. Looks great when working out but also looks professional for work. I highly recommend this product.

I wanted to love this watch, and for several months I mostly did:the swim tracking app was not perfect, but not bad; the walking, running, exercising all seemed fine; I liked the look and got almost 3 days from a charge (non GPS model). But then I tapped it against a doorframe - careless, but not a heavy blow.Cracked the crown and its a goner.Apple won't repair it and I'm out ofluck.I didn't have Apple Care - if I did a new one would only been only $70; as it was, I was out the $250 or so for a new one.So I did it one more time (with Apply Care).But that's it, when/if this crown cracks I'll go with another brand.Just no excuse whatever for making a sports watch so fragile.none.

review_title: Make sure to have it inspected by a Apple representative
review_text: The watch was brand new and I had to call Apple support regarding battery . It would be drained after 8 hours of wear and not even playing music or using fitness tracking or anything.Then 3 days later had issues with the touch screen on the watch.. wojsknr let me touch any app to open it kept taking me to passcode and then it wouldn’t let me put in passcode

review_title: Convoluted, painful setup, decent fitness tracker/mp3 player once you've spent hours to get there
review_text: I can't believe how complicated it is to set up and use this device.I got it for the sole purpose of taking a few of my iTunes playlists to work out with on just the watch and BT headphones. Cause who wants to strap their bulky heavy phone to their arm to workout with?First of all, you should be able to just plug the watch into your PC or sync directly with iTunes through your PC wirelessly. But no, Apple makes you transfer playlists to your iPhone FIRST, THEN transfer to your watch.Ridiculous.And all those itsy-bitsy icons cluttering up the home screen? What moron designed that? He must have had itty bitty fingers.All they had to do was make big icons easy to see and tap, and allow for the removal of any app (Apple or 3rd party) that you don't use. Because even removing all apps possible, there's still like this clutter of 20-some itty-bitty app icons.BUT! Since Apple has made it impossible for other watch/device makers to sync with iTunes I had no choice. And now that I've got it working and know how to use it, it gets the job done.After buying an iPhone I didn't need or want.Thanks a lot, Apple.

I need an upgrade/replacement ASAP.This Apple Watch is less than a year old and has stopped working!!I am ticked off because I can no longer compete for steps with friends or even track my steps.This is the second Apple Watched purchased from Amazon, the first one had no issues yet this one has stopped working completely.I hate this situation!!!!
This is brand new straight from the apple store. I love it so much

review_title: only compatible iPhone 6s and above model
review_text: I finally have the budget to upgrade to a new Apple Watch,after doing a little research on YouTube and talking to a few friends.the GEN 3, seem like the best bet for my needs. really considered the GEN 5 but definitely over my budget.before you buyWarning warning warning!!!I also had to update my phone The GEN 3 is only compatible with the iPhone 6s and above.I had an iPhone 6 I didn’t even think about the compatibility.After all said and done glad I upgradedI wasn’t expecting on buying a new phone but whatever it was time to upgradeYeah my girlfriend got my old Apple Watch what she is really likingShe likes to fitness features speech to textAnd being able to answer phone callsThe GEN 3 just does it smootherAnd the battery life is amazing I charge the watch every other day

I purchased the Series 3 in July of 2019, as an upgrade from my Series 1. I love my Apple Watch. I used to roll my eyes when they first came out, how unnecessary was this? When I was gifted a Series 1, I was quickly hooked.Unfortunately, less than one year after purchasing the 3, the glass around the screen broke while I was putting on a sweatshirt. A quick internet search shows that it’s fairly common with this model. I bit the bullet and bought the 5 as a replacement. Hopefully the issue does not repeat with a newer model.

I don’t need to say anything more about how fantastic this watch is. I was a garmin forerunner holdout for years and finally switched as I wanted a watch to listen to music with while running. The only negative thing I can say about this watch is battery life but I knew that before purchasing it. My solution was using the watch in nightstand mode at night and it’s always charged for a full day of activity. Please note by doing this u can’t use the watch to track sleep but that’s not an issue as i have never had a need to track sleep. I get about 3.5 miles of running in a day and with GPS, heart rate and music playback on and I still have not dipped below 30 percent battery life by the time i take it off to charge at night. The only thing I miss about the garmin ecosystem is the ability to track mileage on my gear/shoes.The reason I am writing a review is to urge u to by Apple Care +. It’s 2.49 a month or 49 dollars for two years of coverage and no I am not associated with Apple. I am just a crazy active person getting about 20k steps a day.I was wearing the watch yesterday while edging the fence line with my gas trimmer. I rolled my ankle on a slope and fell into the fence. The angle must have been just right and hit the upper left corner of the watch off the fence post shattering the screen.I was shocked to find that the cost of the screen replacement on the watch is the exact price I bought it for from amazon. It’s 229. With Apple Care + the cost comes down to 69 dollars. With the care plan u are covered for two years from date of purchase and they allow for two accidental damage repairs over the life of the policy. The only catch is u have to add the plan within 60 days of purchase.That’s all I have to say. I used to say AirPods were the most innovative thing Apple has done in ages but now I feel it’s the watch. Apple pay even more amazing on the watch and being able to voice respond to Tex’s is killer since Apple keeps iMessages locked down to their devices only for the time being.

I was a Fitbit user and the last one I purchased was when I had an Android phone. This past year I switched over to an iPhone and, in hindsight, wished I had an Apple watch. Well, my Fitbit died so I decided to get the Apple 3 watch. I am an elementary teacher and love the discreet convenience of viewing texts and now with the Apple watch phone calls. This 3 is a good value for the price as compared to the newer watches. I figured with the wear and tear at school, I didn't need to spend $400-500 on the latest and greatest based on my basic need for the texting and phone calls. Having said that, I need to spend more time with this watch to learn all the features. I like technology but this is chock full of bells and whistles that I am still learning. Also, watch appeared new with standard high-end Apple packaging. It was charged up but, after pairing with my phone, it did take about 15-20 minutes for the latest software update. It's held its charge fine so far. I have been charging over night but need to see, if I sleep with it like my old Fitbit, how long it will hold the charge.

review_title: Trouble Pairing with my iPhone, Please Help!!!
review_text: I began my smartwatch journey with the Fitbit and have enjoyed my experience with it. Yet, everyone raved about Apple Watch. For quite some time I went back and forth between either staying with Fitbit and updating to the Versa, or making the switch to Apple Watch. Eventually, I took the plunge, and decided to order through Amazon! The watch arrived and looks awesome, seems like exactly what I'll love. BUT, I've been experiencing a terrible time pairing it with my iPhone 7 Plus. Every time I attempt pairing them, the setup process will go to the wrist preference and then pop up with a message that says my watch couldn't pair with my phone. It will then force me to start over and unpair them. I tried restarting both my watch and my phone, and when I went about pairing them this time, it said the watch needed an update before setting up, only to have the same message pop up AGAIN.What can I do to possibly fix this??? I'd really love to keep my watch, but if it simply will not work, my last resort will be returning it and saving up to buy through Apple's website (which I was hoping to avoid since everything on there is sooooo expensive). Any help would be greatly appreciated!!

I like how easy and quick it was to connect to my phone and that I can reply to text messages.There are "canned" messages and you can use the microphone to voice to text, you can also use your finger to draw the letters and it will recognize them.I didn't like that the instructions were printed in a VERY light grey on white paper???? Why didn't they just print black on the white?I ended up googling the instructions just so I could read them with ease.I wish it had sleep monitoring and EKG, but not willing to pay the difference yet to have that feature (it is on Apple 5 series)

This crap won’t even pair with my 6sPlus although it says it’s compatible. I should have known better than to buy anything from Apple ever again.It keeps unpairing as soon as I pair it and it says my software on the phone is out dated. I just did a fricking update to the latest apple software on my phone which is 12.4. This pisses me off because the watch won’t pair after all the trouble shooting videos on YouTube and from the Apple support team. I want my damn money back and you can keep this crap.

I love owning an Apple Watch. For Christmas my husband ordered me a series 3 & ever since I have been trying to convince him that he needs one, too. We both had fitbits for a few years, and that’s what I had before my Apple Watch. He went from the FitBit to a Whoop and after several months he decided he didn’t like it, and I was finally able to convince him the Apple Watch was the way to go. Within 2 days, he admitted he should have just gotten the watch like I did instead of the Whoop. As other reviewers have said, you don’t know, until you know, what the hype is about the Apple Watch. My husband & I are both teachers & it’s nice to be able to quickly see what the notification our phones are receiving to determine if it’s important enough to address immediately, once we have a chance, or just later in the day. The Apple Watch has so many features, and I like every single one that I use daily. (I love the activity rings!)

Battery life is as stated. If you put in theater mode it seems to last 2 full days. I’m not a runner or anything like that so if you used the gps more it would probably last a day or less. It comes with same Apple coverage and you can extend the coverage a year. I wouldn’t normally extend but a cracked face means a total replacement and I’ve dropped it twice and hit the face multiple times.I love watches in general, well time pieces in general, but this thing is so cool. I love that you can customize the face and have multiple faces for whatever may suit an occasion. All of the band options that are available is great as well.

review_title: Not as fitness focused as I was wanting
review_text: Love the watch. Still trying to figure out the fitness specs. Not as fitness savvy as my old Fitbit as I was expecting.

Love my watch. This is the first Apple Watch that I have owned and I absolutely love it. I ordered the 42mm watch. I have small wrists and was worried it would look to large but it looks great.I wear it every day and put it on the charger before I go to bed. I believe the charge would last at least 24 hours. Since I don’t track my sleep I Charge it while I charge my phone.

I ordered this to use with my iPhone 7 and I had to send it back because it did not pair. I was on the phone with customer service with apple and did all the trouble shooting (had the latest update, restarted phone and watch, reset phone settings and restored watch to default) with no luck. I tried on my wife's phone which works with her watch and didnt pair. Super disapointed!

I love the watch. It helps me be on my phone less and has gotten me to be a bit more active. It's a great quality of life gadget. Unfortunately, the screen started to malfunction after 3 weeks of light use! When I look at the watch, it looks as if someone is rapidly swiping up and down and attempting to press all the buttons rapidly. The thing goes completely haywire and I am forced to restart it for a temporary fix.Amazon is sending me a replacement so I'm really hoping this one was a bad seed.
Got this on sale and was very happy about it. Screen was bright and sharp. Connects well with my Iphone 6S plus.I hope it will last at least 2 years or more before upgrading.

Love my series 3 especially for the price. It does more than what I need so I couldn’t justify paying much more for the series 4. I haven’t had it long but love it so far. As most apple products, pretty user friendly and easy to figure out all the different options. The rubber band that it comes with works fine, but does get sweaty underneath while being active so I ordered a new band that I’m excited to try and see how it works. Love the fact you can customize the watch so easily with bands. For sure more “techy” than my fitbits I have had in the past.

review_title: It is fast and battery is okay
review_text: I had the 1st generation Apple Watch and it felt SUPER slow! So decided to buy the 3rd generation and I am glad I did, it is FAR FAR more reliable and quick to perform what you ask it to do. The battery if used normally it lasts me 3 days. Absolutely best watch ever.

The Apple Watch is the best smart watch you can buy. I love that it tracks your heart rate, sleeping, steps, etc. The watch itself came packaged as expected and works like it should. If you're looking for a great watch, but reasonably priced, the series 3 is your go to. It is not the newest one out, but still functions perfectly and there aren't many changes between 3 and 5 (newest).

I bought the Apple Series 3 40mm mostly as a lark for my birthday. The $199 price point seemed too good to pass up. I’ve never worn a smart watch before, and I have to say...I’m enjoying this watch far more than I imagined. The move tracker is good and I like the calories and workout tracking functions. Checking heart rate during workouts is something I hadn’t been able to do before. It’s also a life saver when you’re out and about. The phone rings or chimes and you don’t have to fish it out of your pocket in the middle of grocery shopping. This is especially nice right now, since we’re wearing masks and trying to minimize surface contact. If you’ve got your AirPods in, you can answer a call without any hassle.Also great for controlling music and podcast playback and volume remotely. I can sit in the pool and change music playing from my phone sitting 20 feet away.All in all, a fun and functional device that looks good and makes using your phone a little more convenient.

review_title: Like an extension of your phone
review_text: It is literally like having a mini phone on your wrist. Great for quickly checking notifications without physically checking your phone when you have company or are busy to where that would be slightly inconvenient. I love the options for its workout tracking and it is accurate in calculating your stair climb and running pace.The music app I use through this is Spotify and it does sometimes lag a bit when controlling the music from you watch. The sleep tracking app is not that accurate. It overestimates with sleep saying you went to sleep earlier than you really did but it is cool checking out the cycles of sleep you went through throughout the night.I will say you should get some kind of screen protection. I have had it for about a month now and already have minor scratching around the screen, nothing major though.

Really was looking forward to the watch but when it got here it wasn’t able to pair I tried for hours going through every tutorial and calling apple... NOTHING WORKED. I am disappointed in amazon. If you want an Apple Watch just get it from the Apple store itself. There is no problem with my phone...

What I like about this product: I like the user interface and being able to seamlessly connect it to my iPhone. Paying with my Apple watch (especially during the pandemic) is a huge plus since I don't have to touch my phone out in public!What I *really* dislike: The battery life to this thing is abhorrent. Many people charge their Apple watches over night, but I like keep it on to see my sleep cycle. This gives me short amounts of time to charge it during the day (during breakfast, after work for a bit). I hope the next model significantly improves in this area, but until then--this will have to do.

review_title: Used or refurbished don’t buy from amazon
review_text: Last year I bought the same watch from Apple store and it was awesome but anyway I gave that watch to my brother and again bought the same watch from amazon. What I can feel that something is not right, especially battery how can battery be drained in few hours when I’m not even using it . I think it was used or refurbished. My advice is not to buy apple products from amazon, it was 20$ cheap in comparison to apple store but don’t fall for that trap as they are used or have some technical problems.

review_title: Yes, the Series 3 is still worth buying
review_text: Researched and contemplated whether to get the series 3 or 4. I wasn’t looking for a smart watch but the reduced price of the series 3 intrigued me. I’ve had it for 1 week and I love it and all of the features. I had a cheap fitness tracker before and didn’t wear it everyday but liked having a basic tracker. I can already see that I’ll be wearing my Apple smart watch everyday. My wife has the series 4 and she loves it as well, but the series 3 is perfect for me at less than $200 and the same software that’s running in the latest model.

I have never been one to get too excited over technology, but this watch is amazing! Since I live in MN and the laws are changing August 1st regarding cell phones and driving, I'm very happy to have a way to answer phone calls and be in compliance. Very easy to set up and sync music; love the different features like the heart rate monitor and fitness tracker. Only downside is the limited battery life - I haven't lost a charge yet, but making sure I plug in every night can be a hassle as I'm a forgetful person. Overall, great product, very pleased!

review_title: Very sleek design and great product all together
review_text: My husband loves his Apple Watch and wears it every day. Battery life for the both of us is about 2 days before we have to sit it on the charger. We don’t shower with ours on but it seems to hold up great when washing our hands and things like that. I’m sure it would be fine in the shower but it’s juer a personal performance not to for us.

review_title: Great watch to motivate you to move more!
review_text: I got this watch during quarantine, and even though I've kept up with my exercise routine, my overall activity level has decreased since I'm not biking to school or walking between classes (I'm a recently graduated high school senior going into college in a few weeks). This watch is good motivation to get my steps in and get out of the house; it's easy to lose motivation when there isn't much going on, so this has been very helpful for keeping my overall activity level high enough. The wide variety of fitness tracking features are convenient, and they seem accurate for the most part. They obviously aren't going to give you perfect data, but as long as they are consistent day to day it's a good way to compare your activity levels.As a smart watch, this watch has a lot of small features that are really convenient once you start using them. Music control is nice if you are playing music through a speaker, and it will buzz when you're nearing a turn following a route on Apple Maps. This has saved me from blowing past turns and exits quite often. The battery life has been totally adequate for me, although I'm almost always using it in conjunction with my phone; having the watch run by itself can drain it quicker, although I'm rarely below 40% battery life by the end of the day.This is my first smart watch, and I am very pleased with it. It has surpassed my expectations and there aren't any big criticisms I have so far. It's comfortable, customizable, easy to use, and helpful for a wide variety of lifestyles.

review_title: Won’t pair to my IPhone XR
review_text: Purchased Aug 22, brand new out of box. And it won’t pair to my iPhone XR. I just got this phone so it’s not the phone. The watch seems to be defective ugh. Contacting apple support to confirm.Edit: after being on the phone with tier 2 apple support, amazon support, for an 2 hour over 2 days the device was oddly defective for Apple after resetting watch and phone, powering off both, and resetting network settings. Watch still won’t pair. Getting a refund.

Love it. My first Apple Watch, so I bought the series 3 to see if I’d like it. Love the activity tracker, made me totally aware of how sedentary my daily routine had become - especially since I began working at home because of the pandemic. Now I stand up and move around more. Also like making and receiving phone calls without having to hold my phone- and being able to screen calls just looking at my wrist is great. There are so many great features that I can’t list them all.I use Bluetooth to connect the watch to my phone, so my phone must be with me to use the watch- this works fine for me. Also, I have gotten it wet with no problems, but I have not submerged it in water, although it is advertised to be splash/swim- proof. I also got Apple Care because I am accident prone.

review_title: Glad I Waited, Glad I Purshased!
review_text: I'm so glad I waited for the Series 3. I pretty much own most Apple Products. From the Original 2007 iPhone, to the AirPad, to the MacBook Pro and right up to the iPhone 11. But, I never seemed interested in the Apple Watch. I didn't think it did much at its first Launch. But now with the latest Watch OS 6.1.1, this Series 3 is Fantastic! i love responding to texts, even rejecting call right from my wrist. I love the simple controls as well, when listening to iHeartRadio, Pandora or any Streaming service from my iPhone. At this price, it's the Perfect Choice! I do recommend!

I’ve been wanting an Apple watch for a long time. I don’t mind this watch but the battery doesn’t last as long as they claim, mine last a day, maybe a day half if I push it. You can’t delete all the apps you don’t use, they just sit there and take up space and battery. However, I’m super impressed with the range it reaches, I can leave my phone in the house downstairs and I can be way out in my gardenand it reaches 98% of my giant backyard. Siri doesn’t like to listen to you and and I would like to be able to turn the vibration up but I would buy this watch again if I needed to. Also, one last complaint, I don’t like that if you’re wearing the watch it only tells you have a notification through the watch and not the phone (unless you have your phone open).

review_title: Fragile glass edges, good features otherwise.
review_text: Cons first,A) really poor battery life, have to charge it every single day.B)I have this complaint about many apple products. They have too much emphasis on style and not enough on function. The glass face of this watch should be encased in a frame for support but all 4 sides wrap around to the back of watch leaving the edges very vulnerable to breaking. I use this to track my athletic events, it should be built to withstand that. Make a sport and an office executive model, one sturdy, one flashy.The pros:A) looks really nice <U+0001F606>B) Has a number of compatible fitness apps, with Fitbit you just have their layout.Great clock face options.C) overall good performance.
So far it’s great! Love all the features the Apple Watch comes with especially the message speech to text!

I LOVE an Apple Watch, so much so that after 3 years mine died and I am buying a second.For whatever reason I got a dud. They will not allow me to return it despite on the site it saying I can. I have been through 4 customer care reps and spent too much time "trouble shooting" this product as they will not allow you to return it without going through their reset process. I have been through 4 reps as it must be their break time but they just leave and assign you someone else and you have to START ALL OVER every time. I will buy from Apple, Costco, Target, you name it but NOT FROM AMAZON. I love Amazon, but this is not the product to buy from them. On the Apple Watch, you won't regret it. So convenient. So convenient that I found it hard to go the 2 days without one once mine died!!!DOn't start with it if you don't want to be addicted and fall in love with it :)

I love my watch.I charge it each night and don’t use it for sleep monitoring but days I forgotten to charge it, the battery will last into at least lunch the next day and I’ll just charge it at work during my lunch break.It’s great for getting text because I supervise a team and if I’m in a meeting elsewhere in the building I can see they text me and make sure it’s not an emergency without constantly checking my phone.My son plays with the toy story face and it’s nice to get those notifications when you reach your steps

I bought mine to track my fitness and the Apple Watch does not disappoint. I had a couple of cheaper devices that didn’t record a .lot of data and struggled to sync with my phone but the Apple Watch does everything I need it to. I do keep a case on it to make sure it doesn’t get scratched ams hopefully protect it from getting cracked. I have larger wrists but I bought the 38mm because I am losing weight and my wrists are already thinnning out. Figured the larger size ,igniting look weird over time. I also really like getting my notifications on my wrist because since I have little kids napping in my house every afternoon it’s hard to leave my ringer on and not have the, be disturbed. Also the alarm on it really helps to make sure that when it goes off it only vibrates on my wrist and doesn’t wake anyone else up.

I never understood why people loved apple watches. I’ve always been the type of person who judged others for spending their money on it until I recently went on a Smartwatch crazy. My partner has a Samsung galaxy watch and I went crazy doing research for the perfect watch for my iPhone 6s. Turns out every Smartwatch, from TicWatch to Garmin and Samsung, wasn’t “compatible” with my phone. I decided to get this Apple Watch 3 instead of the 4 because it was cheaper. I got it when it was on sale for $199 dollars which is a deal I couldn’t miss. I’m in love with it, I only take it off when I sleep and it’s such a fashion statement. I get to see all my notifications and track my fitness, listen to music, make calls and answer texts. GPS version isn’t bad at all, works perfectly for my preference because i didn’t want to pay extra for cellular. I highly recommended this watch.Ps: don’t buy another magnetic charger like I did (oopsies) it already comes with that, plus an m/L watch band for those with bigger wrists :)

I kept debating buying one of these bad boys, that is until there was a sudden price drop and a credit that amazon thought would be great to give me, so I jumped on the deal. I’ve never been huge on wearing watches, but the watch was super comfortable and not anywhere near as obnoxious as any other watch I’ve owned. The battery lasts almost 3 days for me, and just about 2 for my wife, even with constant use. I can use way more features of my phone from my watch than I expected and there are even some fun features that I didn’t know about like the walk-in talkie. Definitely worth the buy

Got the 42mm black Apple Watch for 229. Best Buy and Apple had it for around 279-300, so I’m glad I went to amazon! Got it on time, came in the original Apple packaging, brand new. I’m so happy with the watch itself but also satisfied with the price I got it for.

I LOVE my watch!!! It was between an apple watch series 3 and a fitbit charge 3. I went back and forth between the two for awhile after much researching, and decided on the apple watch. I am thrilled with my decision. With the price being $199 and the fitbit charge 3 being $149. I felt that I liked more of the apple features and look. I walked through best buy playing with both and the apple watch was more of what I wanted. I have only positive things to say!

I miss my FitBit Charge which worked so much better for a podometer.Any arm movement with this watch will track as steps so when I am knitting, I can go well over 10K steps.This then gives a bogus reading on the calories burned.I got this instead of replacing my fitbit charge because of the extra features, however, for what I was using, I miss the step tracker on the fitbit.It is convenient, however, to answer my watch instead of looking for my cell phone.

review_title: Better than expected and good value
review_text: After years of using a Fitbit that easily gave me 5 days between charges, my greatest hesitation was battery life, but this watch has been great and the battery has delivered much better than expected. Love the connectivity to my iPhone and appreciate the full integration. Considering the price difference between this and the newest models, it's well worth it. I'm very happy with this purchase and can't imagine preferring the available alternatives at this point.

Wish I could give it 0 stars. I had high hopes with this product as i ordered an iPhone through amazon and it works fine and had zero issues. When going through the setup it said it was locked with the previous owners information and when I contacted amazon support they contacted Apple and they informed me that they can’t do anything with the product and I would have to contact the previous owner. Now that I can’t do anything and I have to return it there are no watches any where near the price this one was. Completely disappointed with this as it should have been caught before the product was shipped.

I received a great deal and finally took the jump and purchased this Series 3.I am so glad I did.I thought the band was very comfortable however the smaller section was just a smidge too tight and caused some sweating underneath.I switched to the longer version and voila!Great fit!I love it that you can buy and replace the bands so easily.I have three more coming with a case (highly recommend a case).I'm afraid of bumping it and cracking the screen so I ordered a case just for that reason.The repair costs is the same as a new watch!I don't want that!The battery life seems ok for me, and the apps seem to work flawlessly.So many options to customize the watch!LOVE IT!

review_title: Apple Prevents Free Audiobooks From Being Transfered
review_text: Listening to audiobooks without my phone while working out is the only use case this watch would have served me. And it's absolutely insane I can't really do that. If you get a legally free audiobook from LibriVox you cannot listen to it on your Apple Watch. How crazy is that? They actively block it so the only way to listen to audiobooks is buy it from them or sign up for Audible and use the Audible app.Let me elaborate. The only acceptable way to listen to audiobooks is to use the Apple Watch's Audiobook or Podcasts apps. Developers of some great 3rd Party audiobook iPhone apps say they can't offer watch-only listening on their apps because Apple's API doesn't let them transfer files to the watch. So the built-in Apple apps are the only option. If you tag an MP3 files as audiobooks in iTunes and sync it to your iPhone, it shows up in your phone's iBooks and work just fine. But the Apple Watch version of the app ignores these files since they weren't purchased from Apple. It's absurd.

I purchased this watch because I have a desk job and on top of that, I am now working from home like many others this year. I’ve noticed I haven’t been active as much because I get so invested in work that I forget to do much else. I wanted a reminder to get up and move and do something else other than sitting at my desk all day. Sure, there are cheaper ways to remind yourself to stand up and walk around but I loved all the other features I read up on as well. I feel like I can more comfortably step away from my work knowing I’ll get notified of any emails, texts, or calls on my watch. Closing the rings has become a daily activity and overall, I’ve found the watch very useful and it allows me to feel a bit less tethered to my desk! So if you’re working a desk job, you may find this useful as well.

Unfortunately, my watch was perfect until it wasn’t. A little over a month after I bought it, it won’t charge or turn on. It just has the green charge symbol with the chord on the screen. I’ve read that this means it’s just DONE. I used my watch all day, every day. So, I must say I’m pretty bummed.

review_title: LOVE Love the 42mm on my small wrist!
review_text: I never thought I’d own a Apple iwatch.I have my iPad and iPhone and didn’t see the need for the watch.I wanted to experiment so I went with the Series 3 as the price was fair.I first purchased the 38mm thinking it would be big enough for my tiny wrists not having anything to compare it with. After seeing what the 38mm was like, I felt the screen size needed to be a tad bigger.I sent back the 38mm and reordered a 42mm.I have to say I LOVE IT!!!!That small increase in the face size makes a world of difference!And the bonus is the battery lasts a little longer.I’m not much of a watch person but now I have a reason to wear one.I love that I can put my phone down in my house and be able to get calls, texts and notifications including if I’m out front or back. I’m still in the WiFi area able to receive connection.Definitely consider the bigger size as you will not be disappointed!!!

Was really excited about getting an Apple Watch. Sadly it’s a bust. Doesn’t pair to my iPhone 8 Plus. Will have to waste my time and go to a store to see if they can do anything about it. If not I will be returning for a full refund.

review_title: Had it sent out to Apple for diagnostic
review_text: Reason for the two stars. My 2 hour wait with Apple, and 2 hours of them having me trying to connect my IPhone XR to my Apple Watch. From what Apple told the watch is not loaded with the latest software, so if you have the newest version on your phone your unlikely able to connect yours as well. I have not received my watch back yet, or a answer on why it keep failing. Shipping was quick though so that was a plus.

review_title: From Fitbit charge dos to Apple Watch series trey.
review_text: Decided to leave the Fitbit family after 2 and a half years. Right off the bat, I see that the battery life and the lack of sleep tracking make this product fall slightly behind the Fitbit product when it comes to fitness and health. Entertainment wise, the Apple Watch is years ahead of Fitbit and the fact that it syncs with my iphone makes it so easy to use. It’s convenient and it also Makes me feel like a basic b****. Give you all another update in three months.

review_title: Probably not a great purchase for me.
review_text: So the product probably does exactly what it is supposed to do.The issue is that I guess I got caught up in the hype and though the watch was a life changer and it really isn’t.Truth is if I stopped using it today I would not miss it.I am sticking with it however hoping that maybe I will discover more uses for it later but from what I have seen so far, and from talking to others with the watch and from the online training that I have found I don’t think that will happen.It tells time and a couple other “neat” things like heart rate and keeping track of time spend during workouts but other than that not much else.

I debated for months before purchasing this product. After reading reviews on Amazon, I decided to purchase. However, now I wish I had read reviews elsewhere as well because I regret purchasing it. After having this product for a month and half, with a screen protector and a bumper on it, a crack appeared on the screen (with no impact). Looking at reviews on other websites, this is apparently a common issue with this version of the watch. The crack wasn't a huge cosmetic issue, but the screen stopped responding to touch because of it. Contacted apple support, but they refused to fix it unless I paid more than I purchased the watch itself for to repair it. Faulty product. Horrible customer service.

review_title: Great Battery Life. Smarter than it appears.
review_text: I bought this watch but became bored of it after a while. However, the notifications and ability to respond is great and I use the watch almost daily. The phone app is also very user friendly and very useful. After having owned it for a while, this watch never fails to surprise me with the functions it has, such as detecting and tracking exercise, or being able to be used to control music on Bluetooth earphones. EASILY worth the money.

I don’t use it for sleep tracking as I charge it every night during sleep, however I believe that given the technology that the watch has, if you intended to use it for sleep tracking it would be effective. The videos I saw about the watch online were mostly vain, and honestly my friends that own the watch sold me on it more than any online material. even videos displaying the capabilities of the watch don’t give it a solid and thorough review. Seeing friends and now my own watch, I see that the series 3 is now beyond worth the value due to price drops since the 5. everyone complains that the new series only have marginal improvements, but when you look at the nonmarginal price effect on older series, I’m all for them releasing new watches frequently as long as there are some (even marginal) improvements. The series 3 at 220$ vs the series 5 at 750$, the series 3 is more than cost effective, and might I add beautiful.

The shipment was fast. Everything is as described. Except for the charger. I’ve used the watch for one day and i turned on power reserve mode. Then I put it on charge over night. Still doesn’t work. I’ve tried charging it through the plug adapter and also my computer. It does work. And the worst part is when I look up on Apple help, it tells me to hold on to the side button until it shows an Apple logo. It never showed up. Nothing. I tried holding different buttons no matter how long 10 seconds a minute. Still on power reserve mode, even after leaving it on charge for overnight. I’ve previously bought a watch from Apple store, normally when it’s on power reserve mode, and you charge it it changes to a big green lightening showing that it’s on charge. But this does not show anything. What I think this watch could be refurbished, and some things are malfunctioning due to can not charge. Please consider this before buying it.

review_title: Awesome watch you didn’t know you needed till you get it.
review_text: I love my iWatch,like most people, I didn’t know what I was missing until I had one and now I don’t get up without putting it on for the day. It’s been super handy as it vibrates and rings when people call or text and so I don’t miss near as many calls. I like the activity app! Witch integrates data from the iWatch Strava app without problem. I love the Strava app for my cycling cpu and it works awesome on the iWatch. I get my heart rate, distance, mph, average mph, time, elevation gain, Ect. From my iWatch. Love it!

review_title: Yes, you do need a watch to make you get off your butt! LOL
review_text: I have long held out on buying a fitness watch stating that I didn't need a device to tell me I need to workout or get up off the couch. Well.....I was wrong. At first it annoyed me, now I go to battle with it everyday to achieve my workout goals. Having said that, it does not let you increase the amount of time you would like to exercise or how many hours you want to stand and move for one minute. Your stuck with the preprogrammed times of 30 minutes and once every hour for 12 hours respectively. The only thing you can change is your move goal (calories burned daily). I do love that you can share your activity with other watch owners. I find the encouragement, support and competition enjoyable.

review_title: Very disappointed! Doesn't work and can't return have to "repair"
review_text: I received this product on 7/1. Haven't been able to use it yet because the screen goes black every time I select an app. I've spent hours on the phone with support to try and resolve the issue. Called Amazon support they didn't help, they sent me to Apple. Called Apple support they are asking me to send it in for "repair". Brand new product that doesn't work and no one will exchange it for another. I am extremely disappointed in the customer service from both organizations.

review_title: The Apple 3 is worth the money!
review_text: I am so happy with my purchase of the Apple 3 watch. I was recently using the Fitbit, but I had a lot of issues with it (two watches to be exact), so I decided to try Apple.THE BEST DECISION!I chose the Apple 3 because of the price and also because it does everything I need it to do. It also rated very high on Amazon and from a friend.It is waterproof, so I can swim with it on, as well as walk, run, or whatever else I chose to do. I can receive texts and phone calls and monitor my heart rate.I also like the feature that allows me to share/compete with a friend(s) and the little token awards along the way to keep me motivated.

I got this as a present for my wife who has always wanted one but was unsure if the cost was justified. I decided to start her off with the Series 3 watch. She loves it. She can quickly respond to texts without needing her phone nearby and she can answers calls through the watch as well. Also one of her favorite things is how easily she can change watchbands to fit her changing style or seasons. This is a great buy and will definitely recommend to others

review_title: Great for my needs, better then I expected.
review_text: Very nice watch, easy to set up but it takes a little why to pair it with your device (~10 minutes).Very stylish.I had to order a separate band because my wrist is quite big and the original one wouldn’t even reach around, but it’s not their fault because an 8” wrist isn’t very commonMany designs of faces to pick from, although I hate every other design except modular.

review_title: Good for workouts but can’t hold a charge
review_text: It’s an Apple Watch, so the critiques are for the watch itself, not the listing. It came on time and nothing was broken. Charger worked well too. The watch itself has a rather poor charge hold and I can never use the sleep tracking because it would be dead by morning. Oh, don’t even try to take it into the pool. It says water resistant and it has a pool workout, but my last one broke after only a few strokes out. That all being said, I do love it for normal workouts or just a busy day. I can change my songs without navigating through a menu, workout tracking is pretty accurate, and you can create your own watch face.

Well I am using this watch from last one yearand want to saythatitssimply Awesome !!This was my firstwatch which I purchaseda year beforebutbased on its performanceandfeatures it encourageto givethis review.This apple smart watch and appsaregood,Looks classic though bought 3stripsfrom amazon :).The onlything I dont like is the price of this product,Lol obvious its apple and cantexpectprice lower than this.Over all I am happy to have this watch andit keeps track of all my health .I like the Amazon expediency and range of products—- makes my shopping for gifts so easy and affordable.

This is my third or fourth apple watch. I keep breaking them but they are addictive. I broke my last one and didn’t get extended coverage bc the way they break is covered by product warranty. However, last time, it wasn’t! Smh it would have cost $250 to get a series 3 replacement. I found this and got the warranty. The way that it break always breaks is, the face detaches from the watch so, I got the face protector this time. It came brand new w/ the charger and extra band. I had to update and sync and it was good to go. I’m pleased with my purchase
Yes apple is bad

review_title: MISSING THE WATCH IN THE BOX
review_text: Be cautious about buying the used model from Amazon Warehouse. I received a box with the charging cable, 1/2 wrist strap, AND NO WATCH! I’ve been a Amazon Prime member for nearly 8 years and have never seen anything like this happen before.

Upgraded from the original Apple Watch. This one tracks my exercise so much better. I rated the sleep tracking 1/5 because this watch doesn’t do that... There’s supposed to be one released at the end of 2020 that tracks sleep. But I like this watch for reading texts, tracking exercise, and even answering calls is great quality. Couldn’t go a day without it! I love not having to have my phone on me all the time and this watch makes that possible.

This has been a real disappointment in so many ways.Battery life is horrible and you have to charge it every day. It lack basic capabilities that other cheaper tracker have like sleep tracking. The automatic tracking of activities works poorly. And the app is not the most intuitive and to find information on the watch is lacking and difficult to find.Not worth the money.

review_title: The Apple Watch is really a great addition to my devices.
review_text: I’m loving my watch.Still learning more about it every day.Getting messages, email and everything I need right on my wrist.Love the activity function.It really encourages me to be more active.My favorite thing to do is ask it to set a timer when I cook or wash clothes.The only reason I didn’t give it 4 stars is the band.I bought two more bracelet style bands and replaced that white plastic band.It made my wrist sweat.

Received this watch brand new in an unopened box and it would not pair with my iPhone, after an hour trying and on the phone with Apple support I had to send it in to Apple and get a replacement. It took a lot of time and effort to get a working watch. Disappointing!

I transitioned from a Fitbit to an iWatch and boy, was the difference HUGE! I love the interactivity and synchronization with your iPhone. It took me a short minute to figure out the difference but the fact that I can answer calls without having to pull out the phone while its near me is so helpful and also pretty cool :) Overall, it's an awesome product by Apple and would recommend it to all! Totally worth it.

review_title: Will not pair with an iPhone 6
review_text: We already own one of these watches and it works great with my iPhone 7. I liked it so much that I bought one for my wife. Unfortunately, she has an iPhone 6 and the series 3 comes preloaded with WatchOS6 and will not pair with an iPhone 6 or older. You must have at least an iPhone 6s. We have owned many Apple products over the years and this is the first time that I can say that Apple blew it. There are still lots of iPhone 6 in use so it seems crazy to not support compatibility between the watch and iPhone 6. Especially when all they would need to do is allow the user to back down to Watch OS 5.

Like all Apple products I love it easy to use easy to setupI traded from a Fitbit Ionic to this watch no issues with my Fitbit but I have an iPhone and iPad figured must have the watchMy only complaint so far is battery life can barely get 24 hrs on it I know it does more than my Fitbit did but I was getting 3 or 4 days on a charge with itGuess I may half to turn off some options to see if it lasts longer

review_title: Love! Super motivating for work outs!
review_text: Apple Watch series 3 is amazing. For a first time smart watch owner this is all you need. I chose the earlier model because you can’t beat the price and I didn’t need things like the EKG heart monitoring the series 5 has. The rings are super motivating to complete each day. And honestly being able to ping your cellphone from your watch is so helpful! I bought a more slim band than what came with it and I am really happy with this purchase. Only downside is the battery life is terrible. I have to charge it everyday, but I usually do it while I’m cooking dinner after I get home so I’m not missing out on tracking too much. All in all, if this is your first watch and you’re on the fence, I say go for it. It’s a steal of a deal for what you get.

I can see all the readings I want to see at a glance; time, calories, minutes of workout completed and number of hours standing. And when it's time to do a workout, I just click on the little runner in the top right corner and choose a workout. I used a Fitbit before this and had to hope it recognized my workout. Not to knock Fitbit, I had a very basic model, so a comparable one might do some of the same things. Oh, and if I pop something in the oven and need to do other things, I turn my wrist and say 'set a time for 40 minutes" and it does. It's the little things. I'm in love with this watch.I used the word love.

review_title: Exactly what I was looking for!
review_text: I went back and forth between getting an Apple Watch or a Fitbit. I’m so happy with the Apple Watch. I love that it connects to my phone so easily. Looking forward to using the built in GPS to track runs outside. Also love that I’m able to read and respond to texts from the watch as I don’t always have my phone by me. Only 2 stars for battery because mine keeps dying or I wake up to less than 10% battery after it being charged fully the day before. I’ve made some setting adjustments so hopefully fix this issue.

review_title: So happy that I bought it
review_text: I'd tried to use a number of other fitness trackers to avoid buying this watch. I thought that it was just too expensive. What a mistake. Trying to go a less expensive route just cost money, time, and frustration that I could have avoided if I had just bought the apple watch. It's more than all the other trackers could ever offer. I wish that I had purchased it earlier. It really is so good and so much more than I wanted but never knew I needed. Save yourself some trouble and get this watch.

Overall I’m happy with the watch. I’m still learning all the features. I haven’t figured out sleep tracking which if the watch does in fact have I would love to open up. I upgraded from a Fitbit to this and am missing the sleep tracking that my Fitbit gave me. Probably something I need to open or download so I will keep exploring for that.The battery life is pretty much for the day. I can get through about a day and a half.I just learned that I need to clear/clean the speakers after swimming which is an easy fix on the watch.Overall, I’m happy with it

review_title: I love it, only had it about two weeks though
review_text: I love having my text messages on my wrist when I'm not near my phone.I got this to replace my fitbit which I was having problems with.So far it works great.I don't know about water resistance because I'm trying my best to keep it away from water.Sweat doesn't seem to bother it though.I don't love that you have to get a separate app to track your sleep, but its an apple product, you seem to have to have a separate app for everything.

Besides tell time, I don't have to carry my phone to track my steps each day.It reminds me to stand up and move if I sit at my desk too long and reminds my to stop and just breath for a minute.You can customize a lot of things and make it unique for you.I don't like the watch band, but you can buy many types for it and they are easy to change.I got a dressy one and an everyday one.

review_title: What a bummer - item is a lemon
review_text: I purchased this watch just 3 months ago along with Apple Care.In the last 2 weeks I have spent 3 hours on the phone with Apple Care because this watch just plain sucks.The heart rate monitor is off - so much that it will tell me that I've burned 175 calories in a 45 minute spin class (Yeah, I'm the instructor - so basically it's saying I'm practically dead and not moving).Over time, the calories burned are lower and lower by hundreds.How do I know?Well, I've put on another Apple Watch on my right wrist and it's coming up 200+ more calories burned on the same workout.Now, the last 2 weeks it just shuts off for no reason at all.Apple will not help me get a replacement so I'm pretty sure I was sent a refurb or a bad watch.Sucks that I spent the money on something that just isn't up to Apple or Amazon standards.

This Apple Watch series 3 is working fantastically, one month in.The battery life is not great, it needs to be charged a few times each week. Mobile apps, messaging, calls, etc., all work very well. The band is not annoying on my skin, and the materials are durable, surviving light banging and knocking against things like door frames and walls.My one concern so far is that occasionally, the color scheme will change when I look at the watch. Rather than the colors I've selected, the watch will occasionally show blue-green hues for a few moments. I will try to post pictures if I can capture it in the future.

review_title: Great Technology but Native Fitness Tracking App Comparatively Sparse on Data and Functionality
review_text: I was looking for a device that provides in-depth data regarding sleep and fitness tracking. In my experience, the native apps did not provide the detail I expected when compared to a Garmin, at least not without considerable searching within the Health app.Aside from that, this is a great watch that's of exceptional build quality, and the Apple warranty and customer service are exceptional. It just fell short in the areas most important to me. I find with the Garmin that I can still use my iPhone to do many things that this watch did (more conveniently,) and the Garmin needs to be recharged less frequently.

My primary goal in purchasing a smart watch was to use it for running. I wanted a GPS to track my miles and a music player so I didn't have to carry my phone. This watch has provided this flawlessly and so much more that I never expected to want or to use. I love that I don't feel the need to have my phone in my pocket at all times because I can text, email, and talk with the watch and ignore messages that just aren't that important. It has worked flawlessly with my iPhone. I loved it so much I bought one for my sister for her birthday and she loves it too!

review_title: I now see the worldwide hype on theApple watch
review_text: I see why this is the best smart watch out there! I'm so happy they made this series such a good price because it's truly just as good as the series 4 and 5. Everything about this watch is clutch. Arrived 3 days early, installation was super easy, the bands are so easy to remove and you can find different colors and sizes for cheap all over the internet. Lets you add your Cards for apple pay, has all those health features and so so much more. I'm telling you I got this for girlfriend and it's the best present and one she will enjoy so much. Take advantage of this while you can!!

review_title: There are no free apps for this watch! <U+0001F616>
review_text: I haven’t been able to find the sleep tracker on this watch yet and I do NOT want to pay for an appeither.For pete sakes, even a Fitbit has the sleep tracker.Since this is an Apple 3 watch, I was hoping there was a bit more to it when I purchased it, but I’m finding that this watch isn’t all that and a bag of chips!I fail to see why the prices are still so high on this model yet I cannot afford the Apple 5 watch that is a whopping $699.I’m going to give it a little more time to see if it is worth keeping.Not a delightful happy camper on this buy.

review_title: May have saved my dad’s life
review_text: We bought this for my dad for Father’s Day, 3 days later the watch notified him that his resting heart rate was high (140 bpm).He went to the emergency room and was eventually diagnosed with AFib and will have to control it with meds.The watch may have prevented a stroke or saved his life.

review_title: Love, love, love it!! Does so much more!!
review_text: I have wanted an Apple Watch for a long time but not bad enough to pay $300+I mostly wanted to keep track of steps and motivate myself more to burn more calories. I tried to talk myself into another watch to keep track of steps etc. but for the price I was hesitant due to hearing how they would break or crack after a year or two.I love all my Apple products TV, laptop, tablet and iPhone!! So when I saw this Apple Watch at a price I could justify I went for it!! Wow!! It does so much more than I ever new. I was so motivated the first week with the activity app I was getting 15,000 + steps a day and lost two pounds. I am having so much fun with it answered a call on it and my daughter said it sounded the same. The GPS on the phone is awesome too!! Okay that’s enough! Enjoy!!

review_title: Watch they sent me was defective.
review_text: The Apple Watch they sent me was defective. I took it to the Apple store and they confirmed it. Ended up spending a little bit more money on a watch at the Apple store. Will be returning this watch for a full refund

review_title: The face will automatically movefrom regular face to a magnifying size and can't view apps
review_text: Settings will magnify without me touching the settings on the face. Watch will change settings from normal size to a distortedsize . Very disappointment because I really didn't want to purchase another one but the front on my old one popped off and I was told the battery blew up which from others this has happened to is a common thing with I-watches. I called customer serviceand the young lady was very nice but had no Idea how to assist me with my issue. Although she tried but she had no idea what to do. For the amount you pay for these watches there should be a longer period to return it, This watch started acting up after 2/3 weeks of wearing it and after the 4th week I was going to return it as a defect and the return period had passed by 4 days.

review_title: It's about the way you feel
review_text: Apple watch might be considered to be hyped but the quality that Apple offers in its products is beyond any questions. I got a 42mm because I felt 38mm watch would be smaller for my wrist size and I was right.This watch was perfect on my wrist and I cannot feel better after purchasing this watch.It is very easy to set-up and use and also makes using your Iphone easier. Now, i don't have to take my phone out of my pocket every minute to check the notifications.It also tracks my fitness.I'd definitely recommend this watch to any buyer. It is very much in fashion and at the same time, the technology is not all that old as in Apple Watch 1 and 2.

I really like this watch. I recently switched from a Fitbit to the Apple Watch and here’s the pros and consPro: talk to text, works much better with an iPhone, fair amount of apps such as weather I can view on the watch, water resistantCons: sleep trackers are a joke (the main thing I miss from my Fitbit) and the battery life.

review_title: Great, but some iffy things started happening
review_text: Bought this back in June, worked great for 3 months and then suddenly it would glitch a lot. Like I had a password on it and then it would get stuck on the keys when I tried to enter it. I just took it off because I was tired of delaying with it. Lately I’ve been having more problems with getting stuck on screens and just like being all glitchy and getting stuck on different screens I may be using. I’ve had to hard resent it a few times and that seemed to fix the problem.Not sure if the glitches are due to the newest update or because I bought it through amazon where a lot of epitope have had problems with their watches. Like the hey sent us defector watches. Not sure, hopefully just the newest update and not the watch. Otherwise that’s really disappointing of amazon to treat its customers like that.

Every review I read said this would work with iPhone 5s and up. My son has a 6s and it would not pair with it after googling what was on the watch screen I found that the phone was compatible but the watch itself had been updated so it would not work. Just wanted other people to be aware.

I ordered this product on April, 2 and I was told it would arrive on April 7th then it moved to April 8thbut luckily I got the package early. Overall the packaging was nice came in perfect condition came with a charger and an extra strap for a m/l wrist. Happy with the product easy to use but takes a bit to set up.Edit: so the battery life is great I was using it all day went on a jog and walk. I woke up at 9:30 am and put it on the charger at midnight and it was 65% impressive battery life!!!!

review_title: What haven’t I had this watch all along?
review_text: This watch has made communicating and tracking health goals much more easy. I am constantly in meetings and it helps to be able to do quick replies without reaching for my phone. The watch is much more accurate than any Fitbit I have owned. I highly recommend it!
